reviewDescription: This VPN is not as good as other I have used in the US because you can't connect to the closest major city for your connection due to limited amount of servers in the US. I live near Las Vegas in Southern Utah and I can't connect through Las Vegas, Los Angeles, San Francisco or even Seattle my closest server is Atlanta or Mexico City which means I get a slower connection to the internet and limits file sharing an 4k video when using the VPN however when traveling to Europe I wasn't able to stream any videos or pictures on my Delta flight after paying $50 for the privilege of having internet access on my 10 hour flight. The reason I paid the $50 was to watch Netflix and You Tube I was a bit upset by the extremely slow connection then I remembered I had installed Tunnel Near on my Galaxy Note 10+ for which I had an external screen, so I switched on Tunnel Bear connected through Atlanta and presto I was suddenly able to surf the internet and watched videos and movies from all my streaming apps in 1080P with no buffering throughout my entire flight. Amazing. I guess Delta throttles it's internet connection to the point of making it unusable to customers even after they suck $50 from your bank account completely ripping customers off for there hard earned dollars but my Tunnel Bear saved me from this horrible scam because they can't throttle your internet connection while using VPN like Tunnel Bear. Tunnel Bear works great in Europe and has servers all over the place in Europe so when I was blocked from using Discover+ outside the US I simply connected through Atlanta again and streamed My Cat from Hell and I got to watch on my portable 15.6 in screen in 1080P with no buffering by connecting my screen to the phone using the Dex feature and a USB-C data cord (I can connect my phone and use it as like a desktop using the Dex feature either wirelessly or through USB-C and it works flawlessly on most devices except my Roku where there is a 2 second deley for some reason making it next to impossible to use my mouse I have tried both my expensive Roku devices and have the same problem the audio doesn't sync properly to the video either I can mirror cast to the Roku but the screen on the phone is 2 sec or more ahead of the phone screen and it's definitely the Roku and not my phone because wireless casting works perfectly with my Fire stick and my Vizio smart TV and Roku has no support for the problem online. My advice get a FireTV device for casting not a Roku.) That said I highly recommend Tunnel Bear for it's extremely low price it is a great value and works pretty well but not as well as others such as Nord VPN which costs a lot more money.

reviewDescription: This is a fine little gift as a stocking stuffer, or a small gift to add to a larger lot. It is nothing great. It is a simple tool for opening boxes or beers. reviewDescription: I used a different (earlier?) version of this knife and the current version addressed many of my concerns with that model. It keeps the same small, sturdy form factor, weighs almost nothing, great for hooking onto a belt loop. With the new bottle opener, I wouldn't recommend putting it in your pants pocket, it catches easily. The bottle opener itself seems to work well without adding unnecessary flourishes to the tool. One complaint I had before and still is that it's a little cumbersome to open one-handed, although now you could potentially practice hooking onto the bottle opener. Unlike the previous version, though, this one locks in place when open, and immediately feels safer because of it. I feel comfortable gripping a little tighter around the body knowing the blade isn't going to chop down on my finger. There's a little thumb catch to release the lock and close it back up. It comes reasonably sharp, and that beak-like point is great for starting a cut -- once you get started, easy draw slice. A convenient knife to have on hand.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2025

reviewDescription: I'm giving this little guy a 5 star simply because I couldn't find a reason for regret.  It's compact, lightweight, and the carabiner-styled clip is a nice touch.  This is one of those items that should only be considered for small/quick applications.  Opening boxes, letters, a quick cutting of rope, etc.  But definitely not for the dragon or zombie slayers.It's just a simple flip-open lock-blade.  No nonsense.The handle is made of a solid piece of hard plastic resin, allowing it to survive many drops and it's overall construction will see it last thru a large number of small applications and functions.  Though, it doesn't feel very comfortable to grip tightly.  Another flaw I found in it's design (though it really couldn't be avoided) is the bottle opener.  Because it's the same width of the blade, the tips of it can be a little "pokey" to the hands.  Nothing too sharp, but just something to be aware of.All this with an equally compact price tag...this is a great stocking-stuffer.  Nothing more.
reviewTitle: A nice little novelty lock-blade knife

reviewDescription: It's a very cool and cute knife. It's bigger than it seems and comes with a good edge on it. Good ergonomics and grip too. The lock is a liner lock. It's secure, but note that it clicks twice when fully opened & locked. At one click, the blade can still be folded shut again. Check that the liner is angled into the locked position.The bottle opener design is bound to catch on your pockets and tear threads, so I recommend clipping this to a belt loop or external piece of gear. The opener does also act kind of like a flipper to help you open the knife.It's secured together by Torx screws so you'll need that driver set to do any work on it.It's a fun & giftable knife, and small enough to EDC. This blade shape is pretty good for shaving kindling to get a fire going. It also wouldn't be bad for making pulled pork or peeling carrots. It opens tape & boxes just fine. In a pinch, the large hanger mechanism could be used kinda like a clothespin, to pin something up or to keep something rolled up. Don't put too much strain on that hanger loop though!Cool and recommended item!

reviewDescription: Von dieser Veröffentlichung hab ich schon sehr früh erfahren und deshalb sehr darauf hingefiebert.Doch dann, was soll ich sagen? Alles klingt gut, alles klingt nach Garbage, aber irgendwie klingt alles so ähnlich! Sonst haben ihre Alben immer so viel Varianz! Ein Song ist mir viel zu schnell, bis ich mich dran gewöhnt habe, ein anderer ist langsam und melancholisch, das nächste wieder ganz anders. Hier nicht! Es ist nicht alles total gleich, es ist nicht schlecht aber einfach nicht so gut wie erhofft.Oder hatte ich einfach nur einen schlechten Tag oder zu hohe Erwartungen? reviewDescription: When I was four years old I kept imagining different kinds of bands that could make me excited to listen to music. The two key kinds of groups are essentially both idm based metalcore and can be broken down into fire (bring me the horizon, wage war, underoath) and water (sleep token, make them suffer, spiritbox). The reason I specifically loved this one is I was a boy who liked cartoon men and monsters who wanted a power rangers cd- something I could study that was an unusual color like purple or pink. This album is nasty- I've Had Boyfriends Before and the ingredients list based reality of what this is - is very Nasty. I Do want this published because I think it's incredible that a man can play these songs in a power rangers costume and not be called dino-core-but I will say-The electronic/vocal passage on dangerous sounds like being locked in a room with shaggy during an led lights Beer party. There are heavy riffs that sound very aqua monster as in To Say like VEnom- it sounds very intentional- it wouldn't make sense for it not to be based on the research I've done? Otherwise- it's very unique, honestly. The closest comparison I can think of is the 1975, but interestingly enough, this one feels a lot less like queer bait. There's an American Football based passage on gethsemane - but - it's very successfully not gross (I'm pretty sure the riffs on that album are supposed to be). All of the metal moments are great. It's super fun. The hard back case is beatiful- I love a solid plastic case. And it's literally purple with flags and swords and stuff.

reviewDescription: I’ve been playing this on repeat over and over since it was released Thursday night.  This album is all good.  Not a bad song on the thing.  My favorites are Look to Windward, Emergence, Past Self, Caramel, and Gethsemane.  This album is so interesting to hear with the musical breakdowns and change ups.  Different styles; hip hop, rap, jazz, electric, pop, metal it’s got it all.  Every musician is fantastic and they do the deity known as Sleep a reverential ritual every song.  This feels like a very emotionally revealing album for the band and it works brilliantly.  I bought the CD form which is great except I wish the lyrics were posted but they are not.  Very bare bones slip with band name and record label.  This goes with the Sleep Token aesthetic or lore so I get it.  Just something I like to have to learn the lyrics of songs.  Anyway, fantastic album.  Like the title says, just buy it!
reviewTitle: Just buy It! Sleep demands reverence.

reviewDescription: When I saw this available for pre-order at the beginning of March (2025) I was excited but skeptical. I was looking for a modest priced, high(ish) resolution Ring camera that allowed remote viewing and exceptional motion detection both during day and night. For previous battery/rechargeable Ring models (cameras and doorbells), I don’t think they had the ability to remote view or record full motion (before and after an event), but this camera can! Wiring electricity to power a camera in my back yard was out of the question, so theoretically, this no wire, rechargeable camera was the perfect solution for my need.Setting up the camera with the Ring app was simple, as was configuring and installing the wall mount.Recharging the battery was confusing at first, mainly because I initially skipped the instructions pamphlet. Essentially the battery slides out of the camera and is directly charged by a mini usb (hdmi) cord (which is included, just no power block). This means the camera never needs taken off of the wall mount. The bottom of the camera can be unlocked and twisted off, allowing you to slide the battery out to recharge. Recharging can be a potential inconvenience, especially if the location you’d like to monitor has a lot of activity (like a GANG OF NEIGHBORHOOD CATS). Side note, the cats were not the reason I bought this—in fact I wasn’t aware of their morning shenanigans until after installing this.With that said, because I came in a little under budget with this camera, I did opt to order the mountable solar panel to hopefully extend the battery life and/or eliminate the need to recharge this camera’s battery altogether. Once it’s delivered and operating for a bit, I plan on updating this review.Overall, for the price, I definitely am pleased with the quality and responsiveness of the camera and am looking forward to see how it holds charge with the solar panel. If you’re looking for a Ring camera that does not need hardwired and like to have the ability to record, remote view, and have accurate motion detections, this camera may in fact be for you!
reviewTitle: I’m so grateful this was released

reviewDescription: I have numerous Ring Stick Up Cams version 3 that are only 1080 so I decided to try one of these.  The video when viewing is much better than version 3 as it is in 2K as advertised; however it records in 1080 which is the same as the version 3.  If you look at the advertising for this 2K camera, it only advertises you can view things in 2K and nowhere does it state that it records in 1080, which I feel is misleading because one would assume it also records in 2k.  However I feel this camera is more sensitive than version 3 and detects motion from a longer distance.  The other think I like is you can set it to detect and record both people and vehicles.  With versions 2 and 3, they could only be set to detect only people, but not vehicles.  I think it is worth the extra $20 over the version 3 for these features.Some reviews say this camera is too large, but it is only slightly larger than the version 3....not enough to really make a big deal about.
reviewTitle: Good sensitive camera but records in 1080, not 2K.

reviewDescription: Here finally  is the re-release of the remastered 4K scan restoration and surround remix of the theatrical film, PINK FLOYD AT POMPEII MCMLXXII (1972). Originally, French director Adrien Maben had an idea to film "The Floyd" (as they were referred to back in the day) in front of classical paintings. The band rejected the idea. After quite a bit of time had passed and the director and the band had still not managed to meet, he went on holiday to Pompeii with his wife. Sometime during his walks around the ruins, he lost his passport. Returning there in the evening to search for it, he found himself inspired by the stillness of the ruins and its atmosphere. Thus was born an idea. Contacting The Floyd again, he proposed that he film them live amongst the ruins in the Roman Ampiheater of Pompeii. They liked the idea and agreed. One of the city council memebers was a Floyd fan in Pompeii, and he convinced the city's elders to do the unprecedented: Allow a rock band to perform and record amongst the ruins of the ancient city. No one would be allowed to do so again for 45 years until, David Gilmore, by then a legend, came back and performed an actual concert in Pompeii at the same site in 2016. This is also available on Blu Ray, BTW .Despite his initial good fortune, Maben's troubles began.  Maben soon discovered that the cables he had run out to the Ampitheater where gladiators once battled were inadequate for the massive power supplies needed, and ultimately he had to run a massive cable all the way back to the city of modern Pompeii with persons posted to guard it. His one week of filming was now down to 3 or 4 days. Still, he wanted to create an "anti-Woodstock." The trend had been to record a band live with the audience becoming another member. In THIS case, Pink Floyd would be performing only to the crew, and we viewers would be their audience--along with a few children who managed to sneak in (one of my friends' cousins in Vico Equense recounted how he snuck in with his friends.) Even in early October, the band perfomed under the burning sun, resorting to even filming some night time shots perhaps because the ampitheater was so much cooler. It also made for some very creative use of lighting to have Waters and Gimour appear and disapppear. Track shots and varius techniques showed the band walking along Veusvius (and Etna?) and when the film was intitally shown, despite good reviews Adrien Maben decided it was a bit too short. He also filmed the band doing some more performances in Paris and rehearsing back in Abbey Road Studies, where they would work for the next year experimenting and recording what would become thier number one album, THE DARK SIDE OF THE MOON--selling over 50 million copies, and staying on the billboard top 200 for 741 weeks- over 14 years. This second release in 1974 would become the definitve theatrical Pompeii film. For years growing up, I would go over to friend's parties. In those darkened parent’s living rooms we would hang our with our girl friends and watch this film on low res VHS tapes. The audio often wouldn't track well. Eventually I would pick up my own "HI FI" stereo copy of the film -that was still new technology. Later,I would snag a much better looking release on Laserdisc in my quest for the perfect copy. Finally, in the early 2000's the film was released on DVD. Alas it was a new, "Director's Cut." Usually, I prefer these cuts in movies, but in this case it was far inferior, and picture quality is middling. Maben added video game-like computer graphics, very dated looking even for then,  cutting away from the band and distracting from the film. Additional inteviews that he shot in 16mm black and white were added, but they only served to slow down the film. Digging into the sub menus, one could find the first cut of the film- but it is only the performances. Interviews with Nick mason ordering breakfast, “I’ll have egg, sausage, chips and beans – and a tea,” and  seeking in vain a pie without the crust. Along with the band’s reminiscences, Waters arguing about over active imaginations hearing a sibilance on a second cut of Obscured by Clouds ( foreshadowing their later acrimonious  breakup), and some very stoned and funny commentary by Gilmour and Waters, the former assuring us that they are not a "Drug-orientated group. Trust us" while being very red-eyed and obviously stoned, had audiences laughing quite strongly. None of that was visible on the DVD as a fluid cut. One could also find an interview with driector Maben, which is unfotunately not available on this release. What is available is a MUCH sharper (Finally) higher resolution presentation, with the same cut much as I saw on VHS, Laserdic, and finally in IMAX at the theaters last week, which should please most buyers. Unfortunately, they did not make the film available in 4K UHD, I suspect beacause they think that demand might not warrant it, but this copy is the highest quality home release we Floyd fans have ever had. Acoustically, much as in the IMAX presentation, this cut is a revelation. The soundtracks are available in three flavors:  2.0 uncompressed LCPM: linear pulse coded Modulation, which is the highest possible quality for a two channel stereo presentation and probably close to how it was originally presented in the best theaters back in the 70's. You also have 5.1 Dolby True HD surround, and Dolby Atmos, in which if you have the right speaksers and set up sounds will seem to emanate from your ceilings as well as to be a totally emersive wrap around experience. I had my head cocked and turning behind me in the  theater as I could hear Richard Wright and Dave Mason's separate voicies behind me, as well as sound swirling around the theater. The famed Steve Wilson has done an amazing job remixing and cleaning up these old recordings, which sound like today's best reference grade audio; that’s no small achievement for a 53 year old film. Subtitles are available in German, Italian, Spanish, and others- but no English, and they are limited to speech and not whilst singing, as is typical of most concert discs, unfortunately. The film is both surprising, at times humorous, and strangely meserizing, with Maben's tracking shots around drummer Nick Mason, and other cuts of the band bringing us into a near trance-like state. Images of frescos from ancient Pompeiian homes, and statues seem erie and fit in with shots of the city and the music, making for a unique experience. I would not throw out my old copy just for the additional interviews and Maben's commentary, but this is clearly the superior and only copy to have if you wish to see Pink Floyd in concert as they were intended to be seen. Online you can find an audio only recording of Nick Mason and Steven Wilson discussing the film after watching it with audience on its 2025 premiere. I’ve waited 40 years to see this properly released. Highly recommended.
reviewTitle: FINALLY! A HIGH QUALITY ORIGINAL THEATRICAL RELEASE OF THE LEGENDARY FILM
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2025

reviewDescription: I bought the old DVD quite a few years ago which was disappointing. So/so picture and bland audio. Missing some content. This new release Blu-ray is phenomenal. Although the picture is 4:3 so it has black bars on the side the pic quality is stellar. I’m simply amazed how well detailed and clean it looks. 4K quality despite it being a 1080p Blu-ray. Note I played it on a 4k bdp to a solid 4K quantum dot tv. The sound quality is remarkable. Dolby Atmos or Dolby TrueHD or pcm all top notch. Exceptional clarity and separation & oomph yet smooth. Of course I’m happy the picture looks good but it’s the sound I’m most after and this remaster delivers. I don’t feel it needs any EQing. Quite frankly that likely would sabatoge the sound. I believe this how all the members wanted it to sound. This is the marquis PF line up as well. You will hear this in numerous other reviews: it’s a must have for Pink Floyd fans or those that simply appreciate quality music presented in an exceptional way. Price is right too so take advantage of that rarity for legit PF hard copies.I do not have “golden ears” and I’m not young but I know what I’m talking about. Been into audio quality since my childhood in the 70s-80s. Was tinkering with home theatre as a high school & college student in the 80s before AVRs were a thing. Today I own numerous DVD-Audio/SACD players, AVRs, speakers, headphones, DACs, tube amps/preamps, etc and have an expansive collection of CDs, HDCDs, dts CDs, DVD-Audio and SACDs, Blu~ray Audio, concert video on both dvd & Blu-ray, and vinyl too. I steam hi-res and have my place set up to listen to any source throughout my house, up to 23 speakers and 3 subwoofers currently whether it’s streaming or a disc. I know sound quality, and this new version of PF’s Live at Pompey is a true treat.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2025

reviewDescription: Pink Floyd at Pompeii (blu ray version)This documentary is a great visual and musical rescue of the best ground-breaking, progressive rock band thus far. You will see an amazing combination of 4 hell of musicians: Nick Mason (drums), Roger Waters (bass, vocals), Richard Wright (keyboards, vocals), and David Gilmour (guitar, vocals). The original vinyl album was produced about 6 years after Syd Barrett left the band. So here you will see the creativity virtuosity of 4 out of the hell musicians: Nick Mason (drums), Roger Waters (bass, vocals), Richard Wright (keyboards, vocals), and David Gilmour (guitar, vocals). I was born in 1964, so my adolescence was marked by this band (despite the bad taste “disco wave” that marked the late 1970s and most of the 1980s).I truly think this blu ray release is visually and musically astonishing. Essentially, you have two main choices here. One is to go directly to the (non-live) concert at the Pompeii Amphitheatre. Here you will be astonished by individual and group creative process leading to the vinyl release. Alternatively, you go the same plus several inserts showing material from interviews to all members of the band. These exchanges are interesting as the reflect differences in personality when it comes to how strong or well-founded provide opinions.Finally, but not least, the images are also astonishing when it comes to the historical Pompeii images.Should I mention a negative issue, it you are interested in the blu ray release exclusively, the package is a bit disappointing. You get a cardboard envelope that opens in two halves with the blu ray in one and a small 6-page booklet. So, no standard rigid blu ray case.
reviewTitle: A great treat from a great time in history of (progressive) rock
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2025

reviewDescription: On possédait ce documentaire en DVD et Blu-Ray depuis pas mal d’années maintenant. En octobre 1971, Pink Floyd a déjà 5 albums à son actif et a terminé « Meddle » qui sortira à la fin du mois, un de leurs chefs d’œuvre, sans doute leur premier. Toujours en quête d’innovation, le groupe demande au réalisateur Adrian Maben de les filmer lors d’un concert sans public dans les ruines de l’amphithéâtre de Pompéi. « Une sorte d’anti-Woodstock » selon les termes de Maben, une expérience comme l’appelle les membres du groupe, misant sur la qualité sonore obsessionnelle du groupe, plutôt que « les réactions du public ». Les prises de vues sont réalisées du 4 au 7 octobre. Puis de nouvelles sessions sont enregistrées du 13 au 20 décembre à Paris pour compléter le tournage de Pompéi qui a subi quelques problèmes techniques mais qui démontraient aussi que le groupe avait de l’humour et du second degré (« Mademoiselle Nobs », blague sympa enregistrée…avec une chienne !). Une version audio remasterisée existait déjà dans le coffret « The Early Years 1972 » en 2016 avec 5 titres et la version alternative de « Careful with that axe, Eugene ». Cet enregistrement est donc loin d’être une découverte. Mais 2025 est l’occasion d’avoir (enfin) une version remixée en audio (2 CD) et vidéo, et pas par n’importe qui car il s’agit de Steven Wilson, musicien passionnant mais aussi un excellent ingénieur du son toujours sur les bons coups, permettant de redécouvrir quelques-uns des groupes qui l’ont influencé et lui font confiance pour le meilleur rendu sonore possible (Pink Floyd bien sûr mais aussi King Crimson, Marillion, Yes, The Who, Black Sabbath, Jethro Tull…). A chaque fois, il frappe fort. Ici le son de chaque instrument ressort fabuleusement, en particulier la batterie de Mason, aucune comparaison avec la version d’origine ou même celle de 2016, le remixage était utile. Il faut dire que le son stéréo du documentaire était juste correct.Ce « Live at Pompeii » représente vraiment une charnière dans la carrière de Pink Floyd. Pas encore devenu le mastodonte qu’il sera à peine 2-3 ans plus tard, le groupe joue encore dans un style post-psychédélique avec une approche toujours expérimentale mais commence à s’en éloigner pour aller ailleurs. « A saucerful of secrets » offre l’occasion à Gilmour de triturer sa guitare comme jamais, tandis que Wright martèle son piano, que Waters s’acharne sur le gong, et que Mason n’en finit plus de frapper ses fûts. Le final du morceau tire plus vers le prog’ presque symphonique, dans une apothéose entre les claviers de Wright et la voix de Gilmour. Ce dernier sait tout aussi bien chanter d’une voix puissante ou éthérée, que distiller une atmosphère mystérieuse comme dans le lancinant « Careful with That Axe, Eugene ». Ambiance planante que vient rompre Waters par son cri strident et toujours aussi terrifiant. Des morceaux qu’on trouvait déjà dans le disque live de « Ummagumma », et qui appartiennent donc à la « première période » du groupe. Mais on sent un changement, une mutation… Si « Atom heart mother » marquait déjà la transition entre les sixties et seventies, mettant fin en quelque sorte au versant le plus psychédélique et expérimental du groupe, cette fin d’année 1971 annonce clairement les grandes heures du Floyd. Quand il joue le morceau en ce début du mois d’octobre à Pompéi, le groupe n’a pas encore sorti « Meddle » où figure la version studio de « Echoes ». Il arrivera dans les bacs quelques semaines plus tard. C’est donc presqu’un « inédit », au moins pour l’équipe de tournage. Cependant, cette pièce épique était en gestation depuis plusieurs mois, et était déjà jouée en concert depuis quelques mois. D’abord appelée « Nothing » (« rien »), puis « The son of nothing » (« le fils de rien ») et enfin « The return of the son of nothing » (« le retour du fils de rien ») en forme de boutade, cette suite de plusieurs idées musicales trouve son aboutissement en une longue symphonie rock. Mais à la différence de « Atom heart mother », le morceau « Echoes » comporte une partie chantée, et se joue uniquement avec le groupe, sans apport extérieur d’orchestre ou de chorale. Une pièce sublime qui préfigure l’apogée de Pink Floyd dans les années 70, de « The Dark side of the moon » à « The wall ». Pour ceux et celles qui souhaitent découvrir ce concert unique, je conseille d’abord la version vidéo très prenante mais pour les fans cette version audio est fantastique. J’ai monté le son et le résultat est tout simplement impressionnant.

reviewDescription: まず、このアルバムというか「映像」から入った私です。某ブロードキャスティング・サテライト放送で、確か画面比率が4：3（笑）だった頃です。なんかエライ所で演奏してる…が初見で得た素直な感想と、このバンドに圧倒された私です。もちろん、レココレは特集をやるだろう…いや、再発ライブ盤特集かも…（笑）。現実は黄色手品楽団という安易な選択…でした。グリークシアター？「スタ列」世代なので、「吹けよ〜」が聴けるのはある意味ゾクゾクする。っていうか、⑤曲目はリピート再生っす。イントロのベー音はカッコイイ！！欲を言えば、もう少し太鼓を前目に欲しかった…しかし、アトモス処理は爆流行だな、

reviewDescription: Questo doppio vinile di "Pink Floyd at Pompeii - MCMLXXII" rappresenta un vero e proprio tuffo nella storia della musica e in un'ambientazione a dir poco iconica. Solo l'idea di ascoltare i Pink Floyd risuonare tra le antiche rovine di Pompei evoca un'atmosfera magica e potente, e questo disco sembra catturare proprio quell'essenza.UN'ESPERIENZA ACUSTIC UNICAConsiderando che si tratta di una registrazione del 1972, ci si può aspettare un suono che, pur non essendo tecnicamente perfetto come le produzioni moderne, possieda un calore e una profondità unici, tipici delle registrazioni analogiche di quell'epoca. Immagino che l'eco naturale dell'anfiteatro romano possa aver contribuito a creare un'esperienza acustica irripetibile, aggiungendo un senso di spazialità e grandezza alle performance dei brani.UN PEZZO DA COLLEZIONE PER GLI APPASSIONATIIl formato in doppio LP rende questo prodotto un oggetto da collezione di sicuro valore per i fan dei Pink Floyd e per gli amanti della musica in vinile. La cura nella presentazione e la possibilità di possedere fisicamente un documento sonoro di un evento così leggendario aggiungono un fascino particolare a questo disco. È un modo per rivivere un momento storico della musica rock e per apprezzare l'arte di una band che ha saputo trascendere i generi.UN'IMMERSIONE NELLA LEGGENDAAnche per chi non ha familiarità con la performance originale, ascoltare questo disco può rappresentare un'occasione unica per immergersi nell'atmosfera di quel concerto straordinario. La musica dei Pink Floyd, con le sue atmosfere psichedeliche e i suoi paesaggi sonori evocativi, si sposa perfettamente con la solennità e la bellezza antica di Pompei, creando un'esperienza d'ascolto che va oltre la semplice riproduzione musicale.
reviewTitle: Un Viaggio Sonoro Emozionante nel Cuore di Pompei

reviewDescription: This is a criticism of my purchase experience regarding this software , not a criticism of the software itself. I received an empty  box with a pc key number card. This was first time I bought software without a cd disk. I prefer the old fashion way. Pop a cd in and install the software to your computer. The card with the activation key numbers only provided  a Pinnacle website link, but no instructions on the downloading process to follow.  When I went to  Pinnacle website there was only the option to buy the software but no option  to download it after purchasing it from Amazon. I then contacted Amazon customer service three times via chat to get instructions on how to download the software. They were unable to provide step by step instructions . I was given an Amazon links but it did not resolve the issue.I then went online to find out what the process was .  I found instructions on the Amazon website which stated to go to my orders , find the software purchased and  there should be a download option next to the order . Tried this but could not find any download option next to the order . I even looked in the digital downloads section and software library but still could not find this purchase.  I literally spent almost two hours trying to download the software but no avail.I will again state that I prefer the original way to install software , receiving  a cd installation  disk.  It is easier, less time consuming and less frustrating.The Bottom line is I had to return the box  it to Amazon and I will buy the software directly on the Pinnacle website.

reviewDescription: When I was four years old I kept imagining different kinds of bands that could make me excited to listen to music. The two key kinds of groups are essentially both idm based metalcore and can be broken down into fire (bring me the horizon, wage war, underoath) and water (sleep token, make them suffer, spiritbox). The reason I specifically loved this one is I was a boy who liked cartoon men and monsters who wanted a power rangers cd- something I could study that was an unusual color like purple or pink. This album is nasty- I've Had Boyfriends Before and the ingredients list based reality of what this is - is very Nasty. I Do want this published because I think it's incredible that a man can play these songs in a power rangers costume and not be called dino-core-but I will say-The electronic/vocal passage on dangerous sounds like being locked in a room with shaggy during an led lights Beer party. There are heavy riffs that sound very aqua monster as in To Say like VEnom- it sounds very intentional- it wouldn't make sense for it not to be based on the research I've done? Otherwise- it's very unique, honestly. The closest comparison I can think of is the 1975, but interestingly enough, this one feels a lot less like queer bait. There's an American Football based passage on gethsemane - but - it's very successfully not gross (I'm pretty sure the riffs on that album are supposed to be). All of the metal moments are great. It's super fun. The hard back case is beatiful- I love a solid plastic case. And it's literally purple with flags and swords and stuff.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2025

reviewDescription: I’ve been playing this on repeat over and over since it was released Thursday night.  This album is all good.  Not a bad song on the thing.  My favorites are Look to Windward, Emergence, Past Self, Caramel, and Gethsemane.  This album is so interesting to hear with the musical breakdowns and change ups.  Different styles; hip hop, rap, jazz, electric, pop, metal it’s got it all.  Every musician is fantastic and they do the deity known as Sleep a reverential ritual every song.  This feels like a very emotionally revealing album for the band and it works brilliantly.  I bought the CD form which is great except I wish the lyrics were posted but they are not.  Very bare bones slip with band name and record label.  This goes with the Sleep Token aesthetic or lore so I get it.  Just something I like to have to learn the lyrics of songs.  Anyway, fantastic album.  Like the title says, just buy it!
reviewTitle: Just buy It! Sleep demands reverence.

reviewDescription: Ich kenne die Band erst seit einigen Monaten, aufmerksam geworden bin ich durch einen Youtube Auftritt des Drummers bei Drumeo. Ich dachte mir, WTH, ich muss mir die Band genauer anhören. Die letzte Platte "Take me back to Eden" war ein Meisterstück, dachte mir, es wird schwer dies zu überbieten. Heute kam die Vinyl Ausgabe des neusten Werkes und was soll ich sagen... So schön kann Musik sein, nur Geduld, einfach mehrfach anhören und nicht unbedingt mit dem Vorgänger vergleichen. Meine Favoriten nach langer Überlegung: Titelsong, Provider, Damocles, Infinite Baths, heißt aber nicht, dass der Rest schlecht ist, im Gegenteil. Sehr gute Platte für mich ohne Schwächen.

reviewDescription: Metal, R&B, djent, pop, electrónica ambiental… Todo convive en un equilibrio precario pero magnético, como si Deftones, Bon Iver y James Blake se juntaran para hacer un grupo.Pero claro, esto no es para todos. Si no tienes una mente abierta, mejor ni te acerques. Y si tu brújula musical se detiene en la seguridad de lo predecible, quizás te pase como al crítico de Mondosonoro, que le dio un 4/10 probablemente porque no entendió nada o esperaba un disco más “de género”. Lo de Sleep Token no se escucha con prejuicios; se escucha con fe. Mi nota: 8,7/10

reviewDescription: I haven’t written a review for a new release in quite awhile. I think the last one was Springsteen’s Letter To You. And in some ways, this is Elton’s Letter To You. A letter to us. It’s a return to form, inspired by lifetime fan Brandi Carlisle. It does not merely avoid embarrassment, but successfully rolls back the years. And it deserves better than the one or two sentences most folks have written. Look, I’m a huge Elton John fan since 1970 when I chased his limousine down Broadway in NYC following an appearance on the Dick Cavitt show (!) I played (and play) piano, And in my high school and college years Elton made me a legitimate rock musician. Honky Chateau and Don’t Shoot Me changed my life. And Someone Saved My Life Tonight became biographical. His music was the soundtrack to my life. I’ve never missed a release. Some in my mind have soared (The One, Songs From The West Coast) others remained intriguing for a song or two (Less Than Zero anyone?) But I’ve always loved him. (And there's a great easter egg embedded in the title song!) So I think that this album deserves better than the one or two sentences most have written so far. So here are my thoughts:1. The Rose Of Laura Nyro opens the album in the manner of GYBR’s Funeral For A Friend. A large, sprawling melodic swell that may not quite be the masterwork described by Bernie Taupin (in the liner notes) but will surely give you a sense of “Hey, this is going to be all right”.2. Little Richard’s Bible is (not surprisingly) a stompin’ rocker about the legendary flamboyant bouffant-ed  rock’n’roller turned preacher. (Wish Andrew left Alton's laughter at the end in the finished mix) Elton kicks ass - indeed!3. Swing For The Fences really does swing! Accurately described as a true collaboration, the voices blend beautifully in this ode to hope, optimism, and joy. This is one my wife and I have started to sing and boogie to in the privacy of our own home! (Remember, I was a fan in 1970!) This was a song Brandi & Elton wrote with their kids in mind. It's true for kids of ALL ages! Great stuff - and if you don't find yourself inexplicably screaming out "Suffragette!" during the closing bars, wel,, you just weren't there. WYKYK.4. Never Too Late - This one feels like generic filler - even though it was nominated for an Oscar last year. Nice thoughts are expressed, but this one doesn't linger in my memory, though it does evoke a little taste of Tiny Dancer. Just me.5. You Without Me is pure Brandi. It would have fit perfectly on her great  2021 disc In These Silent Days. Beautifully harmonizing with herself, it demands to be listened to with open ears. Elton’s voice won’t be missed, though he plays gently in the background.  And I say that with all respect to both artists. Read the story behind the song in the booklet. It’s lovingly heartbreaking. Any parent who has struggled with the increasing independence of their adolescent child will surely relate. Kids grow up.6. Who Believes In Angels is the first masterpiece on the album. Classically melodic, with a lovely keyboard counter melody and an absolutely classic Elton John bridge, this song soars. And when Brandi’s voice takes off (“What will the angels do with you and I?”) soaring as Elton’s did 50 years ago I dare you not to feel reverberations of Goodbye Yellow Brick Road. Reverberations from an echoed memory, not from Elton “recycling” an older melody. This tune stands on its own. And here's the Easter Egg. Elton was inspired by Leon Russell. They recorded the album The Union together in 2010.  It meant the world to Leon, who surprised Elton with the closing song In The Hands Of Angels. The angels were Elton's manager and Sir Elton himself, referred to as "the governor". This song - Who Believes in Angels - has a powerful bridge, and during its final, powerful singing of the line Elton plays a slightly deepened, slightly louder bass line - of D-E-F-F#-G The same notes, in the same rhythm as Russell's immortal opening to his well known song, Delta Lady. Brilliant.7. The River Man starts off like a ballad duet before evolving into an all out rocker, with a little nod to Elton’s recording of Pinball Wizard along the way.  God, I’d love to hear The Stones cover this one! (Andrew you can make this happen!)8. A Little Light - A soulful duet. A lovely “the world’s a mess (Elton) but things will be alright (Brandi)” type of song. I find myself singing this one sometimes throughout the day. “Let a little light on in the world”. Indeed.9. Someone To Belong To - OK. This is a pretty generic, pleasant song that probably would have worked well as the album’s closer. But wait…there’s one more.10. When This Old World Is Done With Me - Oh my. This is the song that brought Sir Elton himself to tears during the recording sessions. Elton feels this song deeply in his bones. It’s his life. And his voice sounds strong and assured. The chords are simply played in a 4/4 rhythm. “Release me like an ocean wave / return me to the tide”. It evokes The Diving Board and all that THAT album (apparently heard by no one but me ;) tried to convey. But now its personal. It brought Elton to tears, as it did to me. As it possibly will for you.What else? Well, kudos to Andrew Watt for his production. And guitar playing. But especially for his production. This was such an easy project to screw up. It could have sounded stylistically too old. Or too “affected” and too new. It could have been Paul Buckmaster- ed to death with either of these artists. Watt resisted the temptation to do any of this, instead choosing to honor each artists known voice and blending them perfectly with backings that complement rather than distract. You Without Me is appropriately bare bones. The first couple of songs on the album are wonderfully bombastic without without taste. It’s well done.You owe it to yourself to own this album if you are a fan of either of these two artists. Having said that, I really have to salute Sir Elton. His voice sounds fluid and strong, and more importantly he sounds more emotionally involved with this material than he has sounded in many years. Family has centered him. Perhaps the Glen Campbell duet that closes The Lockdown Sessions, along with his recent health concerns have brought him face to face with his mortality. Regardless, his musicianship, his philanthropy, his generosity and humanity (yes, even though I’ve seen Tantrums & Tiaras and his shredding of Brandi’s lyric sheet) all add to the great gift that he - and Bernie, and Andrew L-W - have given to this world.He certainly has been a gift to me. Hey - I’m learning these new songs just as I did 55 years ago. And I’ll play them with undimmed enthusiasm and enjoyment. Just as Elton and Brandi sing for us on this album. Cheers -

reviewDescription: I've been an Elton John fan since 1973 when, at age 14, I discovered him with Goodbye Yellow Brick Road. Since then, I have marveled over his back catalog and experienced the highs and not-quite-so-highs in the years since. Yes, I'm a lifelong fan, but I also expect a lot from Elton and the choices he makes both in his music and his collaborators, from duets (think John Lennon, George Michael, etc.) to full-on collaborations like The Union with the legendary Leon Russell and now this, with the preternatural Brandi Carlisle. The pairing here is brilliant and the result is incredible. Every song is excellent in its own right and each has become an earworm that comes out of nowhere throughout the course of any given day. That the songs also tell stories -- of the artists, their heroes, their families, and even of the collaboration itself -- adds even greater depth to the musical mastery. If you own ANY Elton or Brandi records, add this one to your collection. It will not disappoint. Bravo!
reviewTitle: Brilliant Artists. Incredible Collaboration. Amazing Album.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2025

reviewDescription: Elton John’s latest album, “Who Believes In Angels”,  is a collaboration with Brandi Carlile.First, musically it sounds fantastic, it’s an enjoyable listen. Every so often you get these flashbacks to Elton’s 1970’s heyday. Very well recorded. That’s the good part.The part I don’t really like is that this feels more like this is Brandi’s album that features Elton. Her voice is much more prominent thruout the album. My problem with her is over the past few years she has seemed to shoehorn herself into every legends album or appearance. Joni Mitchell, Loretta Lynn, Dolly Parton, Tanya Tucker, various Rock Hall inductions, etc, she’s there for all of them. And now Elton.It’s not a bad album, but as I said it feels more like Brandi Carlile wanted to make an album inspired by Elton John and this is it, only she got him to sing and play on it as well.
reviewTitle: More like Brandi Carlile featuring Elton John

reviewDescription: I have a large version of this lamp that's a full-size floor lamp. I like it, but it's a room lamp. This lamp is more of an 'area' lamp. It would be good for sitting next to your couch or chair. In my case I use it next to my art desk and bend the gooseneck directly over my work when I paint or when I photograph my paintings. At its highest it's still best when used as a seating lamp as opposed to a tall, full-size lamp.It has both a remote control and buttons on the unit itself. The unit buttons are + and - for brighter or dimmer, a power on/off button and a 'CCT' button which adjusts in order of cool, neutral (cool-warm combo) warm, and warmest. My larger lamp has more hue options, but this is still plenty for my needs.One thing I really like about this model is the ability to swing the top-only portion of the lamp to use it above my workspace and then swing it out of my way when done without having to turn the entire base of the lamp. Speaking of the base, another thing I like is that the base has a very small footprint which tucks easily under the edge of furniture. The lamp head is also fairly small at just over 6", so make sure you realize that this is a smaller, more petite version than other similar styles. I have no complaints, I'm very happy with this lamp.
reviewTitle: Smaller and Lower Size; Great for a Seated Work Light
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2025

reviewDescription: We got this floor lamp for my wife’s office, and honestly, it’s been a really solid pick. She needed something that wouldn’t take up too much space but still gave off enough light to work, read, and sometimes just relax — this checks all the boxes.What I like most is how adjustable it is. You can move the gooseneck around pretty freely, and the height adjustment makes it easy to fit wherever you need it. The lamp itself is super bright, but also dimmable, which is a big plus depending on the time of day or what you're doing.What I didn’t expect — and was a nice surprise — is the little mood light feature. I didn’t even notice it when ordering, but it adds this soft glow that actually gives the office a cozy, almost lounge-y vibe in the evenings. My wife likes to use that setting when she’s winding down or on a late Zoom call.The remote and touch controls are also really handy (no need to fumble around for switches), and overall it feels like a quality build — doesn’t wobble or feel cheap.Definitely glad we grabbed this one. It’s a small upgrade that made a big difference in the room.
reviewTitle: Perfect Lamp for My Wife’s Office – Bonus Mood Lighting!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2025

reviewDescription: The lamp is a bit shorter than I expected, mainly because it's so bright I keep it bent down low enough to avoid direct eye contact. That being said, this lamp is fantastic! We have used it as a desk lamp that curves from behind the desk and takes up zero desk space. We have also used it as an over-shoulder task lamp. This is where it absolutely excels. Using the white light for reading is perfect for me. My daughter uses it for knitting and bead necklace making. Absolutely perfect! The only gripe would be that the magnet on the remote control is not quite strong enough to keep it from sliding down the lamp shaft. But hey, it's a remote, it should be somewhere else anyway. I highly recommend this lamp, especially at this price point.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2025

reviewDescription: This lamp is a great addition next to our couch.  It really lightens up seating area.  The different levels are brightness and temperature are nice to really dial in the amount of light we need based on the ambient light and what we are doing.  When reading we can make the light bright and make it a cool white or we can make the light softer so there's less strain on our eyes.  The brightness can be lowered in multiple intervals, down to a low night light setting.  The hour auto off timer is nice to set and forget so we can have some light near bedtime, but it won't stay on all night.  The adjustable post allows for getting the light at the most convenient height for where we are sitting.  The base is heavy, so it won't tip over too.
reviewTitle: Very Bright, but fully customizable  lamp for reading or just to have ambient light.

reviewDescription: Save yourself time & money and read the reviews before you order…I purchased this for a trip and foolishly didn't check to see if I could insert a plug (because how hard could this be?). Well, I wasn’t able to charge anything with a plug on the entire trip because the plug WOULD NOT FIT IN. Read the other reviews that have the same issue.Unfortunately, I tried to get a refund but as I returned from my trip past the return window, I was unable. I messaged customer service who requested a video and then said I was inserting it wrong (how many ways are there to insert a plug into an outlet, this is not a new mechanism)….they sent back a video of them inserting a plug into it as a demonstration. Their hand was SHAKING with how much strength they were applying to get the plug in. I matched their strength to the point where I thought something would break, and it inserted. Ridiculous how much effort needs to go into inserting a simple plug. If you do not have the strength to apply, avoid. I should have stuck to their older models with better reviews.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2025

reviewDescription: I got this for an upcoming international trip with the idea that it could actually replace one of my existing travel adapters which, though slightly smaller, don't have the USB ports included, so this one can also take the place of my normal phone charging brick, which only has two USB ports. Efficiency for the win.Overall, as you can see from the pictures, this is a bit larger than the adapters I have which don't include the USB ports, but it's not as large as a travel adapter AND a phone charger. Plus this comes with it's own travel pouch, to help keep it protected in my personal item bag.It would be nice if the manufacturer would provide the information about how the USB ports will split up the power when more than one is in use. For me, the fact that they don't provide this is the biggest negative about this product.  Here were my results from a quick non-scientific test:My phone is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. It will show one of four charging statuses: Super fast charging which requires a 45 Watt charger, fast charging which happens with a 25 Watt charger, charging which happens with a normal 15 Watt charger, and slow charging which seems to happen at under 15 Watts but I couldn't find any documentation which specified what exact wattages would cause the phone to display this.When using either one of the USB C ports individually, my Galaxy S22 Ultra would display that it was "super fast charging".When using both USB C ports simultaneously, with one port charging my earbuds, the phone plugged into the other port would only show "charging", so it skipped past the "fast charging" status which tells me that the wattage is somewhere under 15 Watts.I got the same results when using the USB A plugs to charge other devices while keeping the phone plugged into either of the USB C ports.So it's evident that the use of more than one USB port at a time will reduce your charging speeds fairly dramatically. However, this is true of ALL multiport chargers I've seen. It would just be nice if Epicka would provide the specific details.The true use for this device, though is to function as a plug adapter so that you can use plugs from one country in outlets in another country. It is NOT a voltage converter, though, so it's only intended to be used with devices that can handle any voltage between 110 and 220. If you plug in something that's intended for 110 volts into this and you're in a country where the voltage is 220, you're probably going to fry whatever it is that you plugged in.However, this does come with a fuse, that might help protect your devices, as well as a backup fuse if you blow the first one. I would not rely on this though. Only plug in something you know will work with the voltage at your location.Bottom line: I'm very satisfied with this product. It works great as both a wall adapter so that I can use my devices in other countries and as a USB charger for my phone and other electronics, which saves me from having to bring two separate devices. Recommended!
reviewTitle: Excellent quality and only slightly larger than adapters without the usb ports
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2025

reviewDescription: This ceiling fan/light combo is everything I never knew I needed—until I installed it and felt like I’d just added a luxury smart device to my ceiling. First off, the look is sleek and modern, and it instantly upgraded the vibe of my living room. It’s low-profile, so it doesn’t hang down like an old-school helicopter blade threatening your head. It’s more like a stylish fandelier with a PhD in comfort.The fan has 6 speeds, which is great because now I can choose between ��gentle mountain breeze” and “hold onto your toupee.” The reversible motor is a game-changer—cool air in summer, warm air in winter—and it runs whisper quiet. Seriously, it’s so quiet I had to check twice to make sure it was actually on.What I love most is the smart control. I can control it from the remote or my phone, which means I can adjust the speed or lighting without moving from my couch—or bed—because we all know that’s when the laziness hits hardest. The app is intuitive, and it even remembers your last settings, which feels like a small but mighty act of love from a fan.And the lighting? Perfection. Smooth dimming from 10% to full daylight, with three color temps depending on whether I’m working, relaxing, or pretending to host a cooking show. The 600 LED beads really light up the space evenly—no weird shadows or flickering.Installation was straightforward, and most parts were pre-assembled. Even for a DIY-er with the patience of a squirrel like me, it took under an hour to get everything up and running.  The instructions were very detailed and easy to follow.Bottom line: this ceiling fan/light is quiet, powerful, smart, stylish, and saves me from climbing out of bed to turn off the lights. 10/10 would install again—if only I had more ceilings!
reviewTitle: A cool looking fan with brains and beauty.

reviewDescription: This is the second one of these I purchased because the first works so amazing! Should've left a review then, but better late than never.1. With the ease of a remote, you can turn this on and off, dim and brighten the light, and control the speed of air flow on the fan. Ceiling fans can run upwards of a few hundred dollars so this was a great value. I don't need anymore for my house currently, but would most definitely but again in the future if needed.

reviewDescription: I recently installed the 70-inch Doozoler ceiling fan with lights in my living room, and it has significantly enhanced both the comfort and aesthetics of the space. reviewDescription: I have been a CorelVideo Studio Ultimate user since 2016. Recently, I had to do a hard reset on my computer which erased all memory and unfortunately I did not have my serial # to reinstall the Corel dvd. So I was hesitant to purchase this newer version with all the mixed reviews. However, I took a chance, installed this 2023 version and what a relief!! The interface is pretty much the same and I was able to edit my first comical video within minutes and share with family and friends. I trust the Corel brand and love their product. When I first was exposed to them in 2016, it took some studying and navigating around the software to familiarize myself with it, but now I am a CorelVideo Studio fan and this time I will make sure to safeguard my serial # in case I have to reinstall later.Once you familiarize yourself with how to use the software, then it becomes easy, just like any other skill in life. I am still very relieved that they kept the layout basically the same, obviously with updated options, because I was dreading having to learn a new interface.I first used Corel almost 10 years ago to complete a project in college. I volunteered to do a video presentation within a group and once we got the footage and it came time to edit i said no problem, i will do it. Well, i didn't realize the depth of what it takes to edit a video, especially for someone technically challenged like me, Lol. But I spent a few hours navigating the software and watching support videos if needed and those few hours opened up my mind to all the possibilities of editing. I also had a newfound respect for video editors having an insight into what they do. After that college experience, I continued to use Corel to make home family videos more interesting and funny.

reviewDescription: I have 3 blink cameras and have had them for years. Pros - easy to set up, takes clear videos, if you need help with and issue their customer service is pretty good and the battery life is really good.  Cons - There is quite a delay before you get  A notification, no matter how close to the sync module/Wifi your camera is, which totally negates talking to anyone they are already gone and it can be intermittent in picking up motion if the subject is small (like a kitten). reviewDescription: I’ve been using Blink doorbells for a while now, and decided to upgrade to this one. Overall, I’m happy with it, but there are a few things worth noting if you’re coming from the previous model.First, the video quality during the day doesn’t seem drastically improved l. It’s good, just not a big leap. However, the night video is noticeably better. Much clearer and brighter, which makes a big difference for late-night deliveries or just general peace of mind.One thing I really appreciated is that the app connects to live view much faster now. I’m not sure if that’s thanks to the new doorbell itself or the newer sync module, but the lag I used to experience is basically gone. Big win there.Audio has also improved, the robotic echo that plagued the previous model is not that bad now. Conversations are clearer and more natural, which is great for talking to delivery drivers or guests.Now, about the field of view - yes, it’s a bit wider, but that comes with more distortion around the edges. I installed mine in a narrow hallway, so the wider angle isn’t really useful for me and the distortion is kind of distracting. But if you’re placing it in an open area and want to capture more, you’ll probably see that as a positive.Another drawback is the absence of dual-band WiFi, which is somewhat disappointing given that some competitors have supported 5 GHz WiFi for quite some time.In short, this is a solid upgrade, especially for night vision, audio, and connection speed. Just be aware of the trade-offs if you’re in a tighter space like I am.

And as for combining files into a single pdf, where other packages allow for images and other document formats to be combined in a single pdf, this package seems to only combine documents previously converted to pdf. I'm sorry, but there are other, less complicated and more user-friendly pdf editing and creating packages out there.

reviewDescription: I am a DIY guy, so I got this to try and respray some cabinets I had.  It does take some getting used to and I would recommend tying it out first on a test surface to get use to the various nozzles, spray patterns and distance to apply from. Once, you have mastered the test phase, it is a breeze to use. I was able to repaint my cabinets with an even look . I with there was some guidance bout adjusting the viscosity of the paint . (ie. how much water to add).I found the instruction manual to be very wordy. I think more illustrations would have been beneficial.I must say that one of the best features of this sprayer is the ability to adjust the flow rate. There is a dial at rear of the trigger that allows for this.  Cleaning the sprayer was not as simple as rinsing it off. Per the instructions, I concocted a mixture of water and isopropyl alcohol. This made the cleanup a smoother process.Customer service is via an email address which is not my preferred method for support. I did not verify how long it would take to receive a response but the seller indicates 18 hours.  I do think the bottle that holds the paint could be a bit larger so that I don't refill as often but that being said, I was happy with the sprayer , its capabilities and the fact that it allowed for multiple spray patterns.

reviewDescription: We bought this rotating cleaning roller to see if works better than one we bought in the past with steel bristles. The one with steel bristles had ripped my shoes apart and cut my skin when I stupidly used my foot as support while cleaning grill. This stainless mesh roller looked safe and I hoped it could also clean well. We use our oven and hot-air grill every day but don't clean daily and grates get quiet mucky. The grease and stains seem to bake on real hard and are difficult to clean. The cleaning roller did a better job than expected. It has a lot of power and it cleaned our oven grate and hot-air grill rack real well without too much effort. I used a bowl with some warm water and detergent and was amazed to see how well the roller removed the grit. It got stained as it removed the grit but then basically cleaned itself while keeping turning in the warm water. It also retained a bit of the water and cleaner foam on the roller that I could then nicely use to continue cleaning. I also noticed that on tough stains, instead of holding it down harder I 'bounced' it on/off the grill and that repeated impact took care of some very old, resilient stains. Running it both ways, along and against the wire rods also worked well. Unit is a strong quality and the bright light is a really nice feature, shows where to clean. Very happy with this purchase.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2025

reviewDescription: 1) Charger not included, and that is ok. But no modern smart charger or battery pack I have worked! Had to dig up an old dumb cube to charge it. That means the USB-C port doesn't have the proper ship to communicate its charging needs at all, expecting a dumb cube to pass power through without checking if it would damage the device.2) While charging, blinking lights were stuck at the same 25% level for hours. Then I disconnected, turned it on, and saw that it was fully charged.3) But! I ran it ~60s, it went from 100% to 25%. Not enough time to clean any grill.4) There is no way this is spinning 350 RPM, i.e. ~6 per second.5) Tried for 10s on a small section of my grill, couldn't clean anything. It couldn't even take away a few burnt crumbs that were on my stainless still grates after I had already cleaned them last tim. In their video where it leaves a shiny grill behind as you go must have been either edited or the grill must have been just dusted with some black dust.6) If you apply pressure, then it slows down to a point it cannot physically clean. If you hold it loose, then the chain acts like a wheel, the whole thing just travels along the grate, therefore no rubbing action. You need to hold it down with just enough pressure to have it scrub the grate without slowing down and without travelling along.I was hopeful, but man, such a #fail... :(
reviewTitle: Fails on all fronts, from charging to cleaning
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2025

reviewDescription: As an individual who has grilled all types of food for over 50 years I was intrigued when I saw the Giddy Up.  Anything that can make clean up faster catches my attention.  I’ve used Giddy Up three times and this is my candid assessment.If you are one who always brushes down your grill following grilling,  Giddy Up is a reasonable alternativeto a manual wire brush. If you tend to not clean your grill for days following grilling, Giddy Up is not a good device.Battery life seems to be good, but the device is underpowered. Even on a fairly clean grate, Giddy Up would bind up while going up and down the grate lengthwise.  I discovered operating Giddy Up perpendicular to the grate improved cleaning greatly, and even with reasonable pressure, the motor continued to turn without binding.I will keep this product because since I keep my grill clean, begin under powered is not that big a deal and I don’t have to worry about wire from my brush sticking on the grat3 and transferring to the food.This product is unfortunately over priced and under powered for most weekend grillers.

reviewDescription:

    These are very nice solar lights at a great price. They feel and look well made, quality. Only time will tell.how they hold up outside. They are bigger than expected, in a good way. I always read the measurments but often feel like things I buy are smaller or larger than expected lol. These came packaged well in a good box and properly written manual inside, even though you don't really need it. Just turn the switch to "on" and leave them in sun all day to get a full proper charge before their first night. They can be placed on a flat surface or hung from built-in metal folding handle on top. They even come with springloaded clips thst can be attached to handle to clip to something like a thin branch or such. The clips are small, the size of alligator clips approx, but clamp strongly. The light is proper brightness, not too bright, and a warm waxy yellow glow with gently flickering. Pretty realistic. The construction feels like quality plastic with crystal clear plastic lens, so safe for outdoors near pets etc in case one fell over, no glass to worry about. I liked them so much I promptly bought another set! And from the looks over many other reviews I see I'm not alone, lots of buyers bought more! There is a good size solar panel on top, so it looks like these will capture lots of light for getting a good charge. I could totally see these used indoors on a table or such after being charged outside, that's how nice they look. I really don't think you will be disappointed by buying these, so get some!  Recommend 👍🏼

reviewDescription: I was tempted to dock this compilation one "star" because gathering songs from different years/shows doesn't show  the Dead at their best.  Plus, if you put all the tracks from the 60 CD box on the wall and threw a dart with your eyes closed, it would land on many other worthy tracks that could be on this 27 tracks  set.But what is here is a decent/good example of the band over its 60 years of shows.  Many Dead fans could not afford the high price of the larger box so this will be a taste of the unreleased shows over the decades.  And as with  most compilations everyone will wish certain songs were included and others deleted.  I also have the 60 CD box which I luckily received before the release date, so listening to this 3 CD set I know how hard it was to choose what's on this smaller sample.  The weight of this  sampler of goodies leans toward the '70s, '80s, and '90s.  There's one track from '69 and a few from the early '70's.And don't forget these tunes  are from unreleased live shows.  The sound is up to the usual standards of other live Dead releases.  The remastering is by Jeffrey Norman and David Glassner. Tape restoration and speed correction done by Jamie Howarth.  The discs slip into full pockets inside the four-fold cardboard packaging, plus a pocket for the  booklet which gives a short synopsis of each tune.  Plus I think the cover graphic is pretty cool.This is worth adding to your shelf of  live Dead just to  have more unreleased live Dead.  If I couldn't obtain the big box I would  certainly add this to my bulging Dead shelf of music.
reviewTitle: "THE RESULT OF DECADES ON THE ROAD."  60 YEARS OF LIVE DEAD.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2025

reviewDescription: This light takes up a small amount of space at less than 12 inches tall and less than 6 inches in diameter. It has an attractive wood base in either a like or dark finish. I chose dark, but either appeal to me. The shades come in a variety of styles as well: I preferred the plain buff shade.Often I find these small lamps use a USB cord as source of power, but this has a traditional power cord with an inline switch.  This is not a chargeable device.  The switch is only a few inches away from the base which makes it convenient and easier to locate in a dark room. The power is just on/off: there is no dimming capability. The light is a warm yellow glow enough to read by if on a nightstand.I ordered this lamp to replace a previous one i keep in the bathroom. I like having a smaller lamp for late night or when guests visit so that there is not so harsh lights in the room.Any room in the house would be suitable for this lamp and it will complement or blend in with most decor.There is some assembly needed for 4 basic parts: the base, the lamp shade, a collar to clamp the shade in place to the base and a small appliance sized light bulb. All of the components are a very good quality. Just remember the bulb goes in last. The base appears to fit other small shades as well if you want to interchange looks.Overall a great value!

reviewDescription: I'll use a Wes Anderson quote from July of 2023 to describe his love of another director's work..."The artist has such a strong hand, he can take us anywhere he wants" - Wes Anderson.Since Amazon.com is a shopping website, I will rate my shopping experience: Satisfied.  I purchased the digital HOME PREMIERE copy of Asteroid City, and the transaction was acceptable.Spoilers below...*****************Summary:  Movie about a writer, and his play.  The play has characters that develop on-the-fly with the writers imagination (Conrad Earp).  Clues are left throughout the movie to help you understand the development of each character.  Wes Anderson smacks you in the face over and over by letting you know nothing you're seeing is real (or finished), but you still get attached.  For instance, when you see an awkward Woodrow explain what his mother "was like" (to fellow stargazers) by making a 5-move-combo (instantly), unzipping a pristine photo of his (now dead) mother, your heart drops.  Then, the next line which is Wes, "When did you lose her?  Officially this morning".  A summary can't unpack this movie.  It's just great art from a Master.Quote: "Are you married?  Of course." (During Mexican Standoff)Scene: The scene where we learn how Augie's character was casted by Conrad.  The playwright and the player.Gem:  When Clifford (Aristou Meehan) learns in real time about his character needing to be dared to exist, (waiting to be dared to climb a cactus). Conrad is developing Clifford and the audience is in on it.  (These gems are all throughout the movie)Other:  Jeff Goldblum will win a Oscar for this.  Period.I love Wes Anderson.  I watch his movies every week for inspiration.  I have no doubt I've logged over 1,000 hours of his work (humble brag). Asteroid City will allow me the great fortune of countless hours, to play in a very abstract time-and-space, adoring the creation of storytelling and the characters that occupy that space.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023

reviewDescription: This is a movie about a television documentary on the making of a play. There are three levels: (1) the television narrator, (2) the writer, director, actors, and (3) the play.  The movie is about the interaction of the levels. Yes, it's confusing. Sometimes it is hard to know which level we are in, though Scarlett Johansson is helpfully a blond as an actress and a brunette in the play. The lives of the actors seem to have no connection to the characters they play. The actors question the motivations for the events in the play: Jason Schwartzman complains to the "director" that he does not understand his character--and he is told that that is how he should play the character.  The viewer cannot help sympathizing with Schwartzman because nothing really makes much sense here.  Schwartzman is travelling with his four children who have not discovered that their mother has died.  Her ashes are in one of their tuperware containers. At first it seems that they have arrived in Asteroid City accidentally when their car breaks down, but then it seems to have been their destination. There is an awards ceremony for talented, accomplished kids. It is interrupted by an alien who snatches the town's asteroid--only to return it later are "inventoried it"--whatever that means. So, the film seems to be about various forms of loss.  That's the way I understand its various disparate scenes to come together.  Thus, Johansson as an actress runs away from the play, while her character in the play, a famous actress, contemplates suicide, in despair, it seems over lost lovers.  Meanwhile, she carries on a relationship with Schwartzman (his character in the play is "Augie Steen", though he seems to have no connection with St. Augustine.) by looking through the windows of adjacent motel cabins.  A teacher leading class tour of Asteroid City is constantly counting her students, afraid she might lose one.  All the visitors are quarantined so that word will not get out about the alien--and they seem to experience loss of their individual identities. The actors do not know who they are because they always take on other people's roles, the characters in the play are stuck in roles that they are assigned even if they cannot understand them, and the audience looks to the theater and the actors to reveal truths that neither has. Children lose their identity when they lose their parents, adults when they lose their lovers. Finally, the playwright dies six months into the play's run.  There are probably more kinds of loss that I am missing. If all this sounds good, don't get your hopes up. The film is fine to think about, just tortuous to watch. Anderson's brand of stylized acting worked well in The Grand Budapest Hotel because the Stefan Zweig story on which it is based is so emotional. But this kind of acting is really out of place in Asteroid City because none of the characters has any real emotions. It is impossible to connect with them or to care.  The movie isn't a story so much as disconnected events--somehow intent on showing that it itself has also lost its identity. You can reflect on that if you want. It's just not a good premise for a film.

reviewDescription: Im Vorfeld habe ich die Trailer gesehen - ich vermutete einen Movie, der in den 50igern spielt. Tom Hanks (einer meiner Lieblingsschauspieler) ist einer der Darsteller, also hoffte ich auf eine Komödie. Noch dazu mit diesem wahren Aufgebot von Weltklasseschauspielern! Und die Rezensionen hier haben sich  auch mehrheitlich vor Begeisterung überschlagen.Doch, ehrlich, ich verstehe diesen Film nicht! Überhaupt nicht!2x habe ich ihn mir jetzt angesehen … ich komme einfach nicht dahinter, was die Message sein soll. Ist es ein Film? Ist es ein Kammerschauspiel? Man mag mich jetzt als Kunstbanause schimpfen … der Sinn und Zweck des Filmes entzieht sich mir. Ist es ein Blick durch‘s Schlüsselloch, wie es bei Rollencastings zugeht? Hinter den Kulissen einer Filmproduktion? Gegliedert ist das Movie in Sequenzen, wie ein Regiescript oder Szenenbuch. Ein Moderator verbindet die filmischen Puzzleteile. Wie gesagt: ich verstehe das Ganze nicht - und irgendwie bin ich unbefriedigt.Keine Spannung in der Handlung….es dudelt so unaufgeregt vor sich hin. Die Schauspieler sagen ihren Text ohne irgend spürbarer Dramaturgie oder Gesichtsmimik. Sehr spartanisch. Und, keine Spur von Happyend oder dem dramatischen Schlußknall. Die Akteure steigen am Ende in ihre Autos und verlassen den Ort „Astroid-City“, der mitten in der Wüste, am Ende der Welt,  zu liegen scheint. Und da fühle ich mich jetzt auch allein gelassen mit meinem Sinieren! Mitten im Nirgendwo.Ich habe schon einige seiner Filme gesehen. Die fand ich eigentlich immer originell, manchmal skurril. Sollte dieser Film ein Beispiel dessen sein, was uns Zuschauern blüht, sollte die „Künstliche  Intelligenz“ die Materie „Schauspiel“ übernehmen? Fast bin ich verleitet, dies zu vermuten….

reviewDescription: …. Was Ich über den Film denken soll.Vorab mit einem Wort : anstrengend ist er.Und für diejenigen die den Film nicht verstehen : macht Euch nichts draus. Hauptdarsteller Jason Schwartzman sagt es kurz vor Ende des Films selbst,, Ich verstehe das Stück immernoch nicht,,Ich glaube nicht das der Text ihne Grund so platziert wurde.Mein empfinden war nach rund 20 Minuten auszumachen. Aber ich war mehr neugierig als enttäuscht.Was absolut für den Film spricht, und jetzt lasse Ich mal den Film Nostalgiker raus , ist diese Farbenfrohe Bildgewalt. Diese kräftigen Farben gibt es seit den 50er/60er Jahren nicht mehr. Aber genau diese Farbgebung und art Filme zu drehen , hat den Filmen damals diesen unverwechselbaren und ganz eigenen Charme verliehen. Das , was Ich an diesen alten Filmen so liebe.Das andere was für den Film spricht ist natürlich diese unglaubliche Starbesetzung.Scarlett Johansson ist einfach immer klasse. Kann alles spielen und sieht einfach immer umwerfend aus.Und die alten Hasen wie Hanks,Dafoe,Norton,Cranston,Swinton, Dillon geben noch Ihre ganz eigene Note , aber auch Erfahrung mit hinein.Kleiner Brüller ( sonst fand Ich den Film eher Mau was Lacher anging ) der tanzende Roadrunner im Abspann.Und nochmal zum ,, nicht verstehen,, …. Ich glaube manche Filme muss man oder soll man einfach nicht verstehen. So bleiben Sie aber im Gedächtnis.Mir persönlich kam der Film vor wie ein Mix aus dem eigentlichen Film und dem Casting bzw. einem Making of.Also auf diese Weise dann doch irgendwie genial gedacht und brilliant gemacht. Ich denke der Film braucht eine Weile bis er im Gehirn alle Gedankengänge durch hat.Für Leute die einfach mal nur einen Film genießen und abschalten wollen ( wie mich halt ) ist der Film eher schwierig. Wie gesagt, der brauch ne Weile bis er verarbeitet ist bei mir.
