reviewDescription: Mein erster Gedanke, als ich die CD sah, war: „Hoffentlich geht das auch per Download.“ Da stand mir kurz der Schweiß auf der Stirn, muss ich gestehen. Allerdings war meine Sorge unnötig, denn man kann die Software auch herunterladen. Das Installationsfenster hat mir dann aber kurz die Nerven geraubt, weil ich partout die Auswahl des Installationslaufwerks nicht finden konnte. Nach der Installation muss das Produkt noch registriert werden, und dann kann es losgehen. Was mich allerdings nach einiger Zeit der Nutzung irritiert, ist, dass sich das Programm immer wieder kurz neu registrieren muss. Das passiert bei mir täglich. Man kennt es ja von Abo-Modellen, dass diese sich in regelmäßigen Abständen updaten wollen, aber bei einer festen Lizenz finde ich das unnötig. Vielleicht finde ich noch, wie man das Ganze abstellt. Aktuell finde ich das etwas unbeholfen.Allgemein:Ich bin kein exzessiver Cutter, aber ich habe in der Vergangenheit mit Programmen wie Final Cut und Resolve gearbeitet. Insgesamt wird man sich recht schnell zurechtfinden, wenn man ähnliche Programme in der Vergangenheit genutzt hat. Natürlich braucht es, wie immer, eine gewisse Umgewöhnungszeit. Ansonsten ist die Oberfläche modern und man findet sich gut zurecht. Es wird viel Drag and Drop unterstützt, und insgesamt ist das meiste intuitiv.Leistung:Ich war zu Beginn etwas verwundert, denn Vegas lief nicht so wirklich flüssig. Ich kann nur empfehlen, die Einstellungen zu überprüfen. Den dynamischen RAM habe ich stark erhöht, da dieser standardmäßig sehr niedrig eingestellt war. Selbes gilt für die Grafikkartenbeschleunigung, die ebenfalls ausgestellt war. Mit einer guten Grafikkarte und einem leistungsfähigen System kann man hier einiges optimieren. Hier heißt es probieren und schauen, was das System hergibt.Features allgemein:Vegas hat alles, was man so gebrauchen kann, und der Kreativität sind kaum Grenzen gesetzt. Das Programm komplett auszuschöpfen, werden die wenigsten. Es gibt unzählige Transitions, Effekte und Tools, die das Leben einfacher machen. Nur die Vorlagen der Bauchbinden finde ich recht mäßig. Hier musste ich mir erst ein paar eigene Layouts zusammenbasteln. Das geht aber insgesamt problemlos, und es gibt viele Einstellungsmöglichkeiten. Mit Keyframes kann man dann noch spezifischer werden.AI-Features:Was ich ziemlich cool finde und auch nutze, ist das AI-Feature „Speech to Text“. Damit kann man Tonspuren in ein Transkript umwandeln und auf Basis der Textblöcke schneiden. Das Analysieren der Tonspuren klappt insgesamt sehr gut, und bei Bedarf lassen sich Textstellen leicht korrigieren. Mit diesem Feature wurde eine weitere Möglichkeit geschaffen, punktgenau zu schneiden oder auch Textstellen schneller zu finden. Untertitel können ebenfalls generiert und direkt integriert werden. Allerdings ist die Markierung im Transkript etwas unintuitiv – Shift + Klick markiert die Textblöcke, das hat mich anfangs etwas Zeit gekostet.„Text to Speech“ finde ich ebenfalls recht fancy. Hier kann man Text mittels AI in Tonspuren umwandeln. Je nach Sprache hat man eine große Auswahl an möglichen Stimmen. Für Deutsch stehen z. B. 10 verschiedene Stimmen zur Verfügung. Ich präferiere Katja und Maja, die für eine KI-Stimme recht gut klingen. Bei deutschen Texten mit englischen Begriffen muss man eventuell etwas nachbessern. Auch hier kann man die Stimmlage anpassen oder die Geschwindigkeit ändern. Dieses Feature hat definitiv Potenzial für alle möglichen Zwecke.„AI-Masking“ habe ich bisher noch nicht ausgiebig getestet, aber schnell generierte Masken sind nie verkehrt. Vom „AI-Sharpening“ bin ich bisher nicht so überzeugt – es wirkt eher, als würde nur die Klarheit erhöht. Überzeugt mich vom Look her nicht, das wäre eher etwas für Videos mit einem etwas kantigen Stil.Insgesamt ein gutes Schnittprogramm mit vielen Möglichkeiten und einer dauerhaften Lizenz – ideal für alle, die Abo-Modelle nicht mögen und nach einer soliden Alternative suchen.
reviewTitle: Gutes Schnittprogramm mit viel Potenzial und cleveren AI-Features.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in Germany on October 16, 2024

reviewDescription: Nach langjähriger Nutzung eins anderes Schnittsystems war ich auf Magix mal neugierig - auch weil der Preis recht überschaubar ist.Anbei mein Testbericht zu VEGAS Pro 221. Lieferung / InstallationDie Lieferung Erfolg etwas Oldschool per CD und Freischaltcode in einem Pappschuber.Negativ erstmal, dass bei Lieferung das Siegel schon gebrochen war, was laut Aufdruck einen Umtausch ausschließt. Da sei der Hinweis erlaubt, dass man in dem Fall auch nicht nur einen Papierstreifen verwenden darf, der beim Handling schon mal einreißen kann, sondern das Produkt dann blistern oder verschweißen müsste.Unprofessionell ging es bei der Installation auch weiter, weil der Installer von der Windows 10 Firewall erstmal geblockt wurde. Nicht weil das Programm böse ist - weil es in einen temporären Ordner schreiben wollte. Weiter kam man nur, wenn man manuell die Standard-Settings der Windows-Firewall anpasst.Für die Kundenerfahrung bis hier hin wäre es leider nur ein Stern geworden - da muss Magix in Puncto Qualitätssicherung noch erwachen werden.2. RegistrierungNach Installation erfolgt die Registrierung der Software mittels Portal und Zusenden eines Freischaltcodes per Email.Auch eher ein Kundenerlebnis der 2000er aber hat alles funktioniert.Vielleicht absichtlich etwas Retro-Feelung aus der Zeit, wo der nonlineare Videoschnitt auf die Home-Computer kam.3. Start und erste ProjekteNun beginnen die 5 Sterne und auf Anhieb taucht ein recht professionelles UI auf, was an marktübliche Schnittprogramme erinnert. Dezente aber sehr produktive Assistenten und Templates erleichtern das schnelle Einrichten eines Projektes.Im Vergleich zu Produkten aus Fernost oder der Konsumer-Ecke auch keine Werbung oder nerviges Nachkobern von Features.3. Erste Projekte / GPU LeistungVEGAS geht sehr effizient mit den Computerressourcen um.Pre-rendern, Suche, Indexstreifen - alles recht flüssig, selbst auf Standardhardware (i7 + SSD, 64GB RAM)4. Erste Highlites die FilterEffekte und Filter sind reichlich vorhanden und dabei auch angenehm wenig Kitsch sondern "Industriestandard" mit dem man professionell arbeiten kann.Schonmal Extrasternchen für das Verketten von Masken und Filtern - womit sich recht schnell professionelle Effekte erzielen lassen - gerade in Zusammenhang mit den KI-Features.5. KI-Features - die wahre Stärke von VEGAS Pro 22.Bei Punkt 4 war ich froh, das ich etwas ebenbürtiges zum Home-Producer-Standard aus dem Hause Cuppertino gefunden habe. Aber - jetzt kommen die KI Funktionen.Das retuschieren der alten Super-8 Aufnahmen durch Korrektur der Blende, Interpolation von wackeligen 18fps Sequenzen war auf Anhieb ein HIngucker. Gleiches gilt auch für verrausche VHS Sequenzen.Für aktuelle Produktionen ist der Motiontracker sicherlich ein erwähnenswertes Highlite der wiederum mit einer Maske verknüpft werden kann.Somit können z.B. Sprechblasen in der Sequenz ganz einfach dem Sprecher folgen. (siehe 4)In Kombination mit Vordergrund/ Hintergrund-Separation kann aus laufenden Sequenzen die Akteure (oder der Hintergrund) als Overlay in andere Sequenzen übernommen werden.(ohne Greenscreen)Das nur als ein kleines Highlite, alles hier komplett zu Beschreiben wäre zu Abendfüllend.Auch ist der 3rd Party Marketplace für Plugins erwähneswert - kann ich aber nicht als FEature des Produktes in die Bewertung mit eingehen lassen.Scripting und Steuerung per API sind ebenfalls möglich.Scripting machte auf den ersten Blick einen sehr guten Eindruck, würde aber mindestens ein Projekt und damit mehrere Wochen benötigen, um es vernünftig bewerten zu können.Auf jeden fall ist scripting + KI-Filter + Batchverarbeitung möglich, was bequem das Auffrischen alter Videos ermöglicht.Für Entwickler gibt es ein SDK auf Anfrage, um eigene Plugins zu entwickeln.Das ist auf jeden Fall eine sehr lohnenswerte Strategie - der Ansatz hat Potential für eine Kreativcommunity.Fazit: 5 Sterne Wert, da es sich von den Features und Bedienbarkeit deutlich von Konsumer-Produkten abhebt und durchaus in der professionellen Liga mitspielen kann.
reviewTitle: Professionelles UI, Produktive Filter und super KI-Features
reviewedIn: Reviewed in Germany on October 12, 2024

reviewDescription: Im Rahmen des Amazon-Vine-Programms hatte ich Gelegenheit, das Programm VEGAS Pro 22 zu testen. Ich bemühe mich stets, eine objektive Rezension zu verfassen und meine ehrliche Meinung zu dem Produkt abzugeben in der Hoffnung, für Kunden eine Hilfestellung zu sein. Ich freue mich, wenn ich Ihnen weiterhelfen konnte.In einem kleinen Kartonumschlag mit den notwendigen Zugangsdaten kam das Programm unbeschadet bei mir an. Die Installation und Inbetriebnahme verliefen problemlos.Als technikaffiner PC-User seit mehr als 25 Jahren konnte ich einem Test dieses Programms nicht widerstehen, da man sich in den Jahren ja doch so einiges an Programmen und Tools angeguckt hat, mit welchen man seinen Alltag im Digitalen bestreitet. Video-Software wie diese nutze ich vorrangig zum Erstellen von Familienvideos, seit der Geburt unserer Kleinen wieder umso häufiger.Das Programm lässt sich wirklich sehr schön bedienen und wer MAGIX kennt, wird sich hier schneller zurechtfinden. Funktionen und Möglichkeiten gibt es hier wirklich immens viele - und leider ist auch bei vielem, was tiefer in die Materie geht, eine mehr oder minder intensive Einarbeitung nötig, welche sich aber am Ende auch lohnt, Online-Tutorials helfen hier! Mit Willen und ein wenig Zeit merkt man immer mehr, wie alles ineinandergreifen kann und dass man dann doch recht fluffig durch die Features durchklicken kann.Je mehr man sich damit beschäftigt, desto schönere Erinnerungen kann man sich schaffen. Von Intros, über Texte, von schicken Übergängen, über Musik, eigene Audioaufnahmen, Schnitt, und vielem mehr hat man hier alles zur Hand, was man für wirklich hochwertige Produktionen braucht, die nachher auch wirklich was hermachen. Das KI-Reframing ist absolut genial und ich will gar nicht mehr ohne arbeiten, gerade wenn man sowohl Hoch- als auch Querformat-Aufnahmen von seine Liebsten hat.Lange Rede, kurzer Sinn: Wer bereit ist, sich ein wenig mehr in das Programm einzuarbeiten als mit 10 Minuten Handbuch lesen, der kann sich hier wirklich ein aufgezeichnetes Fundament für die Erstellung grandioser Videos legen, das für mich als technikaffiner "Amateur" weit über die Ergebnisse anderer Tools hinausgeht. Viele Möglichkeiten für hervorragende Arbeiten. 4 Sterne von meiner Seite.
reviewTitle: Umfangreiche Möglichkeiten, angenehme Bedienung, Einarbeitung notwendig

reviewDescription: Dear Customer,This movie contains two storylines that feature two very unlikely couples. The first contains a preoperative female-to-male transgender person who meets and falls in love with a gay man. It seems to me that if a woman believes that she is a man and begins the process of changing into a man, then that individual would most likely want to be with a woman. In fact, the idea that a woman would begin taking testosterone so that she could become a gay man seems completely ludicrous to me.The second couple consists of two postoperative male-to-female transgender persons. For the same reasons,this coupling seems as unlikely to me as the first. If a man believes that he is a woman on the inside and goes to all the trouble to surgically alter himself, this individual is going to want to date a man, not another woman. Also, the idea that two people are so in love with each other that they are willing to surgically alter their appearance so that they can look alike is kind of creepy.Unfortunately, because of the unbelievable characters, poor cinematography, and a weak storylines I can only give this movie one star.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2013

reviewDescription: Like others, I tried to like it. I tried very hard. but it can be summed up in a single word: awkward. And just to make it clear, I am an FTM Transgender person. I understand that they were trying to probably make the point that Trans people have real people problems too. The whole time I was watching it I kept wondering WHY I just didn't turn it off. I kept hoping it would make some deep point or miraculously in the end it all made sense... but it didn't. This comes across like a college student's film piece.Warning: SPOILERSOne couple has the 'happy ending', the single person commits suicide, and the other couple obviously has a baby. The suicide is just a stupid cop-out. By the time we get to the big emotional scene preceding it all I could think of is that it was just one hair away from being a temper tantrum, like if the person caused enough of a ruckus that the uninterested person would change their mind. So. Freakin. Stupid. (I have struggled with suicide over the years so the topic itself I do not take lightly. It's just how it was handled in here that I find to be totally stupid.) But the absolutely biggest thing that ticks me off is the baby issue. Why? Because once it hit the point where the Trans guy said he didn't know if he wanted the baby (after previously expressing growing up never wanting kids) that the REST of the focus on the situation was about how the CIS GUY felt! Seriously, the Trans guy does not say ANYTHING about his feelings after that. As a Trans guy I can tell you that it would be one screwed up emotional mess for him to have to sort through even before dealing with the crippling dysphoria of dealing with a body (let alone another life) doing things that completely conflict with the internal perception of their own gender. And the last you see of the Trans guy, he's laying there in bed, massively pregnant, not talking, eyes not open, no expression at all. It just leaves me with the really sour feeling that he felt as if he had to follow the expectation placed on him by others and not what was right for him. So it really felt like the 'real (cis) man' was in control and the Trans guy would just have to be the girl because he got pregnant. This pisses me off to no end. In healthy Trans relationships, traditional gender roles normally do not apply. And they never answered the question how/if the hormones would affect the baby!Sloppy work on the storytelling all the way around and it just ended up really strange.
reviewTitle: I wish I would have passed on it.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2018

reviewDescription: The story is American as apple pie. It's about the extra/unordinary lives of trans-people. The irony of them. They are saving the world from the tyranny and destruction of binary thinking (male/female), yet still long to be part of that oppressive system, while struggling to free themselves from it. In the film, a trans man gets pregnant by his bi-sexual lover. The trans man cannot escape his femaleness despite having removed his breasts and grown a beard (extraordinary!). But all they can talk about is about arrangements for living together and healthcare (unordinary!). I couldn't have been anymore engrossed in this film -- it is photographic -- a slideshow of carefully composed shots. It's a poem weaving simple visual and auditory narratives about trans sexuality among other things, life. The story is sweet, funny, bizarre, incoherent, suspenseful and utterly slow. It waxes and wanes because after "shocking" reveals, there is no urgency. The characters just wait for the phone to ring. They stare into space, have meaningless conversations. It's as if it's easy to be a trans person in America. There is no conflict other than self-acceptance. Yet, that is the one of the biggest struggles of trans people, which the film poignantly portrays. Cynthia, one of the main characters, you can't take your eyes off of and she evokes much sympathy from the viewer. We are invested in her plight. If only the rest of the cast was that good (lines were butchered: no intonation, inflection or purpose). Nick is the second most empathetic character and he's not even trans.  He was more likable than the other three trans characters. Was that intentional? In the end, this might have been a better movie if the actors hadn't been asked to act. However, I see the point. Trans people have to perform a gender -- masculine, feminine -- a persona that doesn't come easily to them because they've been the opposite gender for so many years. The actors struggle with these characters though these are their true-life stories being told. The whole ensemble reiterates the idea that identity is not easily defined. The movie is a film student's final project -- bad lighting, contradictory shots/images/ideas, shoe-string budget -- but it's still one of the best films I've seen in years. You won't be disappointed.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2016

reviewDescription: Absolutly beautiful! I've been seeing similar lights all over town while delivering groceries and food orders and knew I had to have them. I found these and they do not disappoint! First of all you get 10 for 1 great price! Not 2 not 4 but 10! They each have 4 pieces, the top solar panel/ battery. the decorative plastic part the light shines through, the pole which has the stake nestled inside one end.Assembly is easy.Take that stake piece out flip it around and shove it pointed end down into the groundthen attach the pole so you don't accidentally break or bend the pole if the ground is hard or you hit a rock/root.Next Remove the clear protector from the solar panel and the tag on the underside by the battery compartment.Slide lock it onto the clear plastic part the light will shine through.Pop it onto the pole previously set and you're done! Took all of 5 minutes.Then you wait until it gets dark and prepare to fall in love! They light my path nicely with a gorgeous pattern on the ground. Not to bright. Just right. I'm so head over heels in love with how pretty my tiny walk way is now.  Now with these solar powered beauties I have no worries about turning them off and on and no more dark walkway at night when I get home from work. I've included pictures!

reviewDescription: Die Verpackung mit den beiden gelieferten Lampen fühlt sich schon schwer an.Die Lampen selbst sind gut gemacht, es gibt keine scharfen Kanten oder Grate.Die Bedienung erfolgt über einen Schiebeschalter und 2 Tasten.Über den Schiebeschalter kann man den Tag, den Nachtmodus, Dauerhaft ein oder Aus wählen,über die beiden Tasten die Helligkeit und Farbtemperatur einstellen.An jeder Lampe sind magnetisch 2 selbstklebende Metallplättchen befestigt. Zusätzlich liegt eine Ersatzplatte und Schrauben dem Paket bei.Die Magneten der Lampe sind sehr kräftig und ausreichen die Lampen in diversen Positionen sicher zu halten.Ich habe die Lampen für die Sattelkammer eines Pferdeanhängers bestellt - diese hat in dieser nämlich ohne Fahrzeug kein Licht. Das funktioniert sehr gut, die Magneten halten die Lampen sicher auch während der Fahrt.In Summe habe ich 4 Lampen im Anhänger angebracht und meine Damen sind sehr zufrieden damit. Nach einigen Tagen im Gebrauch mussten wir diese noch nicht aufladen.Beim Schiebeschalter muss man genau darauf achten um den Tag oder Nachtmodus zu treffen, Aus und Ein befinden sich an den beiden Enden und sind leicht zu treffen.Die 20 Sekunden bei automatischer Abschaltung sind ein guter Kompromiss, ich hätte mir aber gewünscht die Zeit einstellen zu können.Fazit: Halten gut und sind sehr praktisch.
reviewTitle: Starke Magneten + Einfache Handhabung. Einschaltzeit könnte länger sein.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in Germany on May 5, 2025

reviewDescription: 🔧 𝘾𝙤𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙣𝙪𝙩𝙤 𝙙𝙚𝙡𝙡𝙖 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙛𝙚𝙯𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙚: 𝙩𝙪𝙩𝙩𝙤 𝙘𝙞ò 𝙘𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙚𝙧𝙫𝙚 è 𝙜𝙞à 𝙞𝙣𝙘𝙡𝙪𝙨𝙤L’esperienza parte già bene con una confezione completa e ben curata:2 luci LED da 84 LED ciascuna, sottili ed eleganti.6 piastre magnetiche adesive per un fissaggio semplice e flessibile, in totale  ne servono 4, le altre due sono di riservaSono incluse 6 viti per chi preferisce un’installazione più salda delle piastre nell'armadio: ne vengono utilizzate 4, mentre le altre 2 sono fornite come riserva.L’adesivo delle piastre è molto resistente e, a mio parere, può tranquillamente sostenere le luci anche senza l’uso delle viti.2 cavi USB-C per la ricarica, compatibili con qualsiasi caricatore moderno.𝙐𝙣 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙨𝙞𝙜𝙡𝙞𝙤 𝙪𝙩𝙞𝙡𝙚:  prima di incollare le piastre adesive all’interno dell’armadio, posizionatele prima sulle luci, sfruttando i punti magnetici visibili sulla scocca frontale. Solo dopo rimuovete la pellicola adesiva sul retro e applicatele nella posizione desiderata.In questo modo otterrete un allineamento perfetto, evitando errori: il magnete, infatti, non copre tutta la superficie, ma solo due aree precise.🌙🌞 𝙎𝙚𝙣𝙨𝙤𝙧𝙞 𝙞𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙡𝙡𝙞𝙜𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙞 𝙥𝙚𝙧 𝙤𝙜𝙣𝙞 𝙚𝙨𝙞𝙜𝙚𝙣𝙯𝙖Le Gritin offrono tre modalità intelligenti, facilmente selezionabili tramite un interruttore a scorrimento posto accanto a icone intuitive:𝙈𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩à 𝙉𝙤𝙩𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙣𝙖 (𝙡𝙪𝙣𝙖): la luce si attiva solo al buio e solo se rileva movimento umano. Perfetta per scale, corridoi o cabine armadio.𝙈𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩à 𝘿𝙞𝙪𝙧𝙣𝙖 (𝙨𝙤𝙡𝙚): si attiva al rilevamento del movimento, anche di giorno, indipendentemente che sia buio o meno. Ideale per ripostigli o ambienti sempre poco illuminati.𝙈𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩à 𝘼𝙡𝙬𝙖𝙮𝙨-𝙊𝙣 (icona ON): le luci restano sempre accese, perfette per la lettura o per illuminare una scrivania.➡️ In modalità sensore, la luce si spegne automaticamente dopo 20-25 secondi se non rileva movimento.🌡️ 𝟯 𝙏𝙚𝙢𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙡𝙤𝙧𝙚: 𝙨𝙘𝙚𝙜𝙡𝙞 l'𝙖𝙩𝙢𝙤𝙨𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙖Con il pulsante del termometro, puoi commutare tra:𝙇𝙪𝙘𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙡𝙙𝙖: ideale per un ambiente rilassante.𝙇𝙪𝙘𝙚 𝙛𝙧𝙚𝙙𝙙𝙖: perfetta per cucine o ambienti di lavoro.𝙇𝙪𝙘𝙚 𝙣𝙖𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙖𝙡𝙚/𝙢𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙖: un bilanciamento piacevole per ogni situazione.💾 𝙈𝙚𝙢𝙤𝙧𝙞𝙖 𝙞𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙣𝙖: le luci ricordano l’ultima temperatura selezionata anche dopo lo spegnimento.💡 𝟱 𝙇𝙞𝙫𝙚𝙡𝙡𝙞 𝙙𝙞 𝙡𝙪𝙢𝙞𝙣𝙤𝙨𝙞𝙩à: 𝙧𝙚𝙜𝙤𝙡𝙖𝙯𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙞𝙨𝙖Con un semplice tocco del pulsante "sole", puoi regolare l’intensità luminosa su 5 livelli:10% – 25% – 50% – 75% – 100%, per adattarsi sia a un uso notturno discreto che a un’illuminazione più forte.🔁 Il dimmer è senza scatti meccanici e reattivo, rendendo la regolazione veloce e intuitiva.🔋 𝙍𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙗𝙞𝙡𝙞 𝙚 𝙙𝙪𝙧𝙚𝙫𝙤𝙡𝙞Ogni luce è alimentata da una batteria interna ricaricabile via USB-C, eliminando completamente il bisogno di batterie usa e getta.🔌 𝙄𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙩𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙙𝙞 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙖 𝙞𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙜𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙤 (𝙣𝙚𝙡𝙡𝙖 𝙨𝙩𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙖 𝙥𝙤𝙨𝙞𝙯𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙙𝙚𝙡 𝙨𝙚𝙣𝙨𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙙𝙞 𝙢𝙤𝙫𝙞𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙤):𝙎𝙥𝙞𝙖 𝙧𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙖: la batteria è in carica.𝙎𝙥𝙞𝙖 𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙙𝙚: la batteria è completamente carica.⚡️ 𝙏𝙚𝙢𝙥𝙤 𝙙𝙞 𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙖: circa 2-3 ore. Consiglio di metterle in carica non appena la luce inizia a sembrare meno intensa rispetto al livello impostato, segno che la batteria si sta esaurendo.L’autonomia varia a seconda dell’intensità e della modalità utilizzata, ma è più che sufficiente per settimane in modalità sensore.💡 𝘾𝙤𝙣𝙨𝙞𝙜𝙡𝙞𝙤 𝙙𝙚𝙡 𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙙𝙪𝙩𝙩𝙤𝙧𝙚: se inutilizzate per lunghi periodi, ricaricarle ogni 3 mesi per preservare la durata della batteria.🧲 𝙄𝙣𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙖𝙯𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙢𝙖𝙜𝙣𝙚𝙩𝙞𝙘𝙖 𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙨𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙡𝙚Grazie al sistema magnetico con piastre adesive:Puoi rimuoverle facilmente per ricaricarle.Non servono strumenti o fori, ma puoi usare anche le viti per maggiore stabilità.L’installazione è discreta, pulita e modulabile.✅𝘾𝙤𝙣𝙘𝙡𝙪𝙨𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙚Le luci Gritin sono una soluzione elegante, moderna e pratica per ogni angolo della casa:✔️ Sensori affidabili, regolazioni complete e facilità d’uso.✔️ Installazione furba e magnetica, con materiali ben fatti.✔️ Ottimo rapporto qualità-prezzo per chi vuole migliorare l’illuminazione senza interventi elettrici.🔚 Perfette per armadi, corridoi, scale, cucine, scrivanie e molto altro.
reviewTitle: Facilità di installazione e flessibilità d’uso
reviewedIn: Reviewed in Italy on May 20, 2025

reviewDescription: En casa nos han encantado estas luces para iluminar espacios de una manera eficiente, práctica y muy cómoda.Se trata de un pack de 2 lámparas extremadamente delgadas con batería.Su iluminación es óptima para cualquier necesidad, como por ejemplo cubrir el pasillo y baño para los vaciados nocturnos sin necesidad de buscar los interruptores ni de encender luces que nos deslumbren y molesten al resto de la familia, o tener perfectamente iluminados los armarios de habitaciones y cocina.Son realmente versátiles, además su diseño es compacto, discreto y elegante, con un acabado en aluminio esmaltado con un color muy bonito y los botones perfectamente integrados.Disponemos de tres temperaturas de color y 5 regulaciones de intensidad, además de un sensor de movimiento que podemos activar siempre que detecte movimiento o sólo cuando detecte movimiento y haya poca luz, pudiéndola dejar también siempre apagada o siempre encendida.Disponen de una imantación trasera y unas pletinas metálicas con adhesivo que se adhieren a cualquier superficie de una manera firme y en el caso de no poder adherirlas, incluyen unos pequeños tornillos para asegurarnos de su correcta colocación, tornillos que en mi caso no he usado ya que sobre madera, pladur y baldosas de baño adhieren a las mil maravillas, pudiéndose retirar con un poco de fuerza sin dejar residuo.Su batería interna es de 1800mAh pero su consumo es muy bajo, así que depende de la intensidad seleccionada y el uso que se le dé puede durar muchísimo sin necesidad de cargarlas. Y hablando de cargarlas, este es otro punto a su favor, simplemente hay que retirarlas y usar un cable usb-c (cualquiera que tengamos por casa o el incluido en el paquete) con un indicador en verde cuando la carga esta completa.Su precio es muy bueno para la construcción elegante y resistente y la versatilidad que tienen.Como única pega, que más que pega es recomendación, para ser un producto perfecto tendría que tener una regulación para el tiempo que se mantiene encendido tras dejar de detectar movimiento ya que sus 25 segundos no se pueden modificar.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in Spain on April 28, 2025

reviewDescription: Si alguien necesita una luz que le ilumine el interior de un armario, cajón, etc. reaccionando al momento de abrirlo o cerrarse, en este producto encuentra una solución ideal, de calidad, y muy buen resultado.Calidad de construcción de principio a fin. Cuerpo metálico (aluminio) que pesa muy poco, bastante plano casi sin grosor. Calidad a la vista y al tacto. Es recargable, y a tal efecto aporta el cable para conectarla a un cargador normal y corriente USB C (no incluido). Batería de 1800 mah, que a máxima potencia son9 horas; en cualquiera de los otros cuatro modos de potencia el tiempo se incrementará notablemente.La colocación es de lo más fácil, es con dos imanes muy planos a cada extremo. Se pegan con las tiras que ya trae incorporadas, y listo. Para hacerlo correcto lo mejor es dejar los imanes pegados a la lámpara para tener ya la posición de los mismos, y presionar sobre la superficie que deseemos; así quedará perfectamente a su medida. El imán está en la lámpara, por lo que sobre una superficie metálica ya queda sujeto sin lo anterior. La fácil colocación/descolocación permite retirarla para cargarla muy fácilmente.Durante la carga tiene una luz, roja es cargando, verde ya está cargado. Su luz tiene 5 niveles desde un mínimo a un máximo bastante potente; y no sólo eso, la temperatura de color es seleccionable en tres posiciones desde la cálida de 3000ºK (la bombilla de toda la vida), 4500ºK de color neutro sin ser totalmente blanca, y 6000ºK con luz blanca.Aún hay más. Tiene 4 posiciones de funcionamiento, dos de ellas es para totalmente encendida o apagada, y las otras dos son antagonistas en funcionamiento. Una detecta en oscuras cuando haya luz como al abrir un armario cerrado y se enciende; o lo contrario, se enciende y al detectar la luz se apaga. Es lo que el fabricante define como “acciones”. Tras unos 20 segundos se apaga o enciende según corresponda. Y tiene memoria. Funcionará según se haya seleccionado anteriormente su temperatura de color e intensidad de brillo.Si a todo lo anterior que tiene un comportamiento irreprochable, añadimos que “por su precio vienen 2 unidades” poco más se puede añadir. Por todo lo anterior bajo mi uso y criterio es acreedor de 5 estrellas bien merecidas.
reviewTitle: Gran producto, resultado, y calidad de construcción
reviewedIn: Reviewed in Spain on May 5, 2025

reviewDescription: GRITIN UNDER CABINET LIGHTS 2 PACK:I ordered these lights for use inside kitchen corner cabinets to automatically illuminate the darkest recesses.The lights themselves feel very well made and look of a great quality and there are available in various color shades. They offer sensor lighting which is activated by movement and automatically shuts off when no movement is detected after a set period of time the. Fantastic for my application, meaning that when I open the cupboard doors to recesses of the cupboard is illuminated and then they automatically shut off once the door is closed. They have different brightness settings along with color temperature settings. The pack contains two strip lights and comes with two charging cables plus instructions. I have been lucky that the magnetic back panel adheres to the metal racks within my cupboards but they are supplied with metal plates that can be screwed into non metallic surfaces for easy installation.I really like the quality of these lights compared to my previous set from a different maker. Once you have these and use them your suddenly realised there are lots of places that they make sense to have, and make life easier. So far they have been in use for a month without issue or recharging yet. They did not just meet my expectations but exceeded them totally.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 29, 2025

reviewDescription: I originally read reviews about the Elite Series 2 across multiple forums, and the resounding consensus was this is probably the absolute best quality 1st party controller on the market. After being able to hold it in my hands, this gamer of 29 years can tell you this is indeed, by far, the best quality controller i have had the pleasure to hold.Then i saw i could get it Renewed thru Amazon for $50 less than MSRP! I was hooked! 4/5 stars at first glance! Instant buy! But then i actually read thru the Amazon Renewed reviews, and was immediately horrified. Based on the reviews, it seemed like every Elite Series 2 controller was arriving in terrible shape, with missing and broken parts, improper charging cables, and absolutely filthy. My heart sank into my stomach...I'm a gamer on a budget, so i thought this was a great deal, but read the reviews and prepared for the worst. I even explained my situation and concerns to a local Gamestop employee and got him to set aside an Elite Series 2 box for me in case this Amazon Renewed one came dead on arrival.Then, the moment came to unbox. I was pleasantly surprised to see the carrying case was included and in excellent condition. Opened it up, and the suspense was tangible as i examined the contents and tested the controller...It worked PERFECTLY! No missing parts! No broken parts! No filthy controller! There was a tiny bit of skin flakes i had to use a needle to even get to, but after 4 disinfectant wipes and 30 minutes with the needle, i got that baby looking brand spanking new!!!Couldn't be happier with the purchase! I got the very best quality 1st party controller on the market, AND for a discount of $50, and it was practically and functionally brand new!!!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2022

reviewDescription: Both bumpers barely worked upon arrival, right trigger switch broke in half, inside of controller disgusting, broken parts inside that would get stuck in the trigger area, broken front panel now causing grip to come lose unable to put back on, all in all unacceptable “excellent refurbished” controller

reviewDescription: If you love your Xbox, this is a must have. Get the accessory bundle for it too with the charging block, case, and extras. It just feels of the highest quality- weight, comfort- its just so right for gaming. Tons of customization too for whatever style game you're playing. Plus built in rechargeable battery.All the gamers in the family have these- there are four of them in the house and they've all worked flawlessly. No complaints from anyone. No stick drift, no dead buttons- nothing. I keep seeing reviews where people swear they've purchased multiples and they all die on them and I have had the exact opposite experience. And with the hours I know our older kids put in playing them, they get their workout.

reviewDescription: I love the weight of the controller in your hand. The options you have to customize it are also great. It is a great product--IF NEW. Save your time and just bite the bullet and wait to have enough to buy a new one or from another supplier.I had 2 controllers from this seller and both had issues. I know these are refurbished and it says in description like new. I understand there maybe some wear on the item and 3rd party accessories (like charger cord) however when you say they are tested I would expect there to be no issues with the controllers. Both controllers had issues though both were different. The first one had an issue with the 4 way controller in that it would drift up after being pressed down and stick. That one was rather clean and had the original charger cord, however I sent it back (MISTAKE) the replacement for that was worse!! It wasn't as clean, the charger cord was 3rd party but it was MUCH shorter--if you are going to use a 3rd party item at least make it the close to the same as you can. This controller itself the flip paddles on the back the give on the top placement for short flippers was way off and couldn't be used. If I placed larger flippers it worked fine but then I couldn't use the bottom ones --so in a sense I lost 2 of the 4 extra control features.I contacted the seller and the 1st exchange went well--the 2nd they never responded so I just am sending it back for a refund and will save the extra 100 to get a new custom one.

reviewDescription: After using the Wuben G5 for nearly a month, I can confidently say this flashlight is nothing short of fantastic. Despite its ultra-compact size — arguably the smallest EDC light I’ve ever used — it has quickly replaced most of the flashlights I used to carry daily.What sets it apart is how effortlessly it fits into my lifestyle. It slips perfectly into the coin pocket of my jeans and is so lightweight that I often forget I’m even carrying it. The rotating clip and the 180-degree swiveling head add an incredible amount of versatility — I can attach it to my shirt pocket without it sagging or mount it on the brim of a cap for hands-free work. These thoughtful design choices make it one of the most practical lights I’ve ever owned.One standout feature is the rotating dial used to adjust brightness. It makes switching modes incredibly intuitive and smooth — no double-clicks, long-presses, or confusing combinations. Just turn the wheel and go. For such a small flashlight, the G5 is impressively bright. In my usage pattern (running it on max brightness for 1–5 minutes every 5 minutes), the battery consistently lasted through the entire night. It probably could’ve gone even longer, but I usually top it off daily just out of habit.Build quality is top-tier. There are no rattles, creaks, or loose parts — everything feels solid and refined. It has the tactile feel of a premium, well-engineered tool. Simply put, the G5 doesn’t just feel like another flashlight — it feels like a precision instrument designed with real-world use in mind.In short, the Wuben G5 delivers a near-perfect combination of size, functionality, and quality. It’s a flashlight that disappears in your pocket but shines when you need it most.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2025

reviewDescription: First, this G5 punches way above its class for how small it is! Both in features and output. It’s sorta crazy how many different things they packed into such a tiny package; swivel, RGB, signal modes, magnet, clip, lanyard hole, step-less dial, waterproofing, charge indicator, charging status, and the now mandatory USB-C. Seriously, read the manual because it does so much more than it lets on. And all in the size of pretty much a tic-tac box.The swivel head is NOT a gimmick! You can aim light exactly where you want on a work surface… or use the magnet to stick to the hood of a car and aim it at the fuse box, or clip it to a cap and aim either in front of you or down at something you’re working on.Here’s a random thing I like about it… we have a 2 year old that’s learning colors… he’s obsessed with this flashlight. I put it on RGB mode, which turns the dial into a color selector, and he rolls through the colors and we name them together. We’ve been playing with it almost non-stop. I have to hide it when he’s distracted so he can do other stuff too. LOL!Well, suffice it to say that Wuben has made another cool and actually practical flashlight. I do with they made it in more colors too, a white or brass one would look epic!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2025

reviewDescription: In a word, "Clever".Honestly, I was drawn to purchase this light for two reasons:  first, the cleverness of the "variable color output" and second, the reasonable price.  An added elements of "clever" are the rotating head, the dialing of white brightness or color, and the "pull out and rotate around" pocket clip.The light is a reasonable compromise, but ultimately is a "clever pocket pal" to show friends more than actually use as an Every Day Carry item of utility.Here's a few comments on that compromise: The dialing for brightness is perhaps not the best method of User Interface; the minimum and maximum brightness levels aren't overwhelming, but adequate; the impact of 10 Lumens of colored light output will range from perceivably dimmer to brighter to the eye, depending on the nm (color) of the output, but again, generally useful; the rotating head is useful in conjunction with the pivoting clip for use on a cap or on a strap or in-hand, but the head's size, appearance of construction, and single point of attachment is a bit worrisome for long term durability; after a few pocket carries, the black finish has worn off at corners; the magnetic base isn't confidently strong enough to suspend the light horizontally (width-wise).Now another point of "clever" is the use of a three position slide switch to uncover the USB-C recharge port, unlock the light, and lock the light. The idea is clever, but long term durability is a question.The use of the rotating dial and single push button affords a reasonable and simple method of User Interface, as does the slide-switch / port cover.  All in all, this light is quite clever and reasonably useful, too.  Hopefully, if it is carried and used carefully, it will be a fun and useful light.Four out of five for compromises in performance and construction, even knowing that at this price point compromises are understandable - but I'd have paid more for a more "solid" product with these clever features.
reviewTitle: In a few words - A Very Clever Pocket Light, A Pocket Pal to Show Friends, but Useful, too.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2025

reviewDescription: I ordered and downloaded Family Tree Heritage (FTH) Gold 16 for PC to upgrade my outdated version 15. After it installed I went to open it via the FTH desktop shortcut and received a popup asking if I wanted to let FTH 'Business Plan Pro' make changes to my computer? Since it wasn't FTH ‘Gold’ I clicked No. I then clicked the FTH icon in Windows 10 Start and got the same pop up.  So I right clicked on the desktop icon and went to the file location and tried to open the application by double clicking on it. This resulted in a pop asking me to insert the Activation Key from the email receipt. I inserted the key from my Amazon receipt which activated the application. After activation, the app still wouldn’t open via the FTH desktop shortcut or the icon in Start; both continued initiate the the pop up for FTH ‘BusinessPlan Pro’. My only recourse was to delete the FTH shortcut and Start icon and create a new shortcut on the desktop by right clicking on the original FTH application in C:/Programs and selecting Create Shortcut that works. This has not been a good experience. Other that that, the app works great!

reviewDescription: Not the best SRC offering, but still a good improvement over the more problematic Solar Aquarian. Whiel AE shares some of SA's flaws it at least holds together better and polishes up the worst of them. Articulation is quite good all around. This is a standard SRC super poseable non transforming offering of a robot that on screen is a combiner. The SRC does not combine or come apart. Much like the Sentai/Power Rander robots this one is just a single poseable action figure.It's a strangely proportioned figure, but that stems from the shows CGI robot design, not Bandai. With big honking canoe feet and wasp waist. The printing and paint application is excellent all around. The "soloar" wings are a vast improvement over the SA. They clip onto the legs when not deployed and are much much sturdier. (It's not like they could have been made worse).Accessories are strange. You have the giant fisted extending super punch forced perspective pieces, similar to the SA. But these seem a little better designed. Plus you have a swirling vortex effects plastic dish to punch through and a sign shouting out your move. Different, but I suspect all will be left in the box.Aquarian Evol is a great little robot for fans of the show. While there are tons of Merchandise out there for AE, this is one of the few versions of  the actual robot the show is named after. And probably the only merchandise from the show that is not sporting more cleavage than is absolutely necessary. (Yeah, Amazon search "Zessica Wong" You're welcome.). It's a must have for Aquarion fans. A nice to have but not top priority for SRC fans. Put it on the list to be gotten after you have churned through the Go Nagai's, the Sentai/Power Rangers and the Brave robots and are debating between this and whatever is left. (Get God Sigma and Weissrighter first.)
reviewTitle: A solid middle of the road SRC offering. Vastly improved over the Solar Aquarion

reviewDescription: Previously, I had a Nest smart thermostat.  The Ecobee out performed Nest on every measure except installation.  Once I watched a few YouTube videos I tackled the “common” wire. I really like the fan setting of 15 minutes per hour.  It helps even out the temperature throughout the house. Quality is good and the display easy to read. Set up was intuitive and straight forward.I highly recommend this thermostat!

variantAttributes/0/value: New 2025 ecobee Smart Thermostat Essential - Energy Star Certified programmable Wi-Fi Thermostat - Works with Siri, Alexa, and Google Assistant

reviewDescription: What attracted me to this product was the ability to fine tune the functions, particularly the on/off cycle time. My defunct Honeywell thermostat had a decent cycle time, the new version of that product was horrible, on/off every ten minutes, poor for heating efficiency and very hard on the equipment, and after consulting with their India tech support, confirmed this could not be adjusted. On the other end of the spectrum, I can't say enough good things about Ecobee. I spent about 45 minutes on the phone with their tech support who was excellent, answered all of my questions, had me send photos of my current wiring configuration and confirmed I needed a power block as well, explained clearly what wires needed to go where and then sent me a discount coupon too. I had complete confidence in self install and knew I could count on their technical support if needed (which I didn't). This product completely met my expectations, a bit on the expensive side but worth every penny. You won't go wrong here.
reviewTitle: Top notch company, top notch products!

reviewDescription: This is an excellent thermostat however I feel it should be installed by a professional if you don't have some previous basic knowledge of hvac or you are not somewhat of an above average handy man. This one works well with my heat pump with electric back up in an 1800 sq ft home. I couldn't set one of the features required for set up because of my rural location but Ocobe support was able to send an update to my unit on line within about 30 min. just for my location. They are much easier to work with than the other brand and a real person answered the phone. It is easy to use by controlling it from your phone from any where. I had my own hvac business years ago and so did my brother. We are both retired but I still feel qualified to recommend this unit.
reviewTitle: An excellent smart programable home thermostat.

reviewDescription: This was 100% worth the money. It was easy to set up/get hooked up to HVAC system!It’s super user friendly & I love that I can set temperatures for sleep, home and away. You can even set a temperature for “vacation” which I have not had the opportunity to use yet.I love the ease of mind I have now that I can keep an eye on the temperature of my house when I’m at work, making sure that my animals are at a comfortable temperature!The fact that you can set it to “auto” and set cooling temperatures and heating temperatures, not having to flip a switch back and forth is so nice.An up side - it has the weather on it, and if you live in a super humid place it’ll adjust the temperature based on the humidity by just kicking the fan on instead of turning the actual cooling aspect on. I love that it also shows the humidity level in your house.There’s so many good things about this product, but what it comes down to is that it’s 100% worth the money.I haven’t had it long enough to know about money savings on my electricity bill but I think it’ll help a bit!

reviewDescription: On the positive, pretty straightforward installation, out of the box operation, and integration with the app and web interface. Prompt customer service. On the negative... Well, it's a rudimentary hunk that fails at basic features.You would think that a "smart" thermostat that can already communicate with the internet and with your phone and with Ecobee headquarters can also communicate with other thermostats in the same house. Well, you would be wrong. For all its "smarts" this is a basic standalone device missing an obviously needed feature.You would also think that you could set different schedules for different seasons. Wrong again. You get ONE schedule, and you can customize it to death with temperature settings (but not with start times, see below) , but when you want to change from cooling season to heating season... You have to MANUALLY enter all the settings from scratch. And then do it again (from a piece of paper or something) when the seasons change. That is squarely in dumb territory, not even approaching smart.Oh, and you don't get the option to set the schedule you want. The app gives you 30-minute intervals. The video on the website misleadingly shows minutes, but there are no minute options on the schedule. On the instructional webpage is says "If you wish to change the start time of a particular Activity, simply tap on the Activity (Home, Away, or Sleep) and adjust the time." Except that you CANNOT adjust the time. You can just pick from the options given. Absolute garbage.A waste of $$. Look elsewhere.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2025

reviewDescription: First off.. ATTENTION ALL WHO ARE NOT VERY TECH SAVVY.. IF YOU BUY THIS PRODUCT IT HAS ITS OWN VIRUS PROTECTION AND FIREWALL.. YOU MUST DO A CUSTOM INSTALL AND UN-CLICK THE VIRUS/FIREWALL SO IT DOES NOT INSTALL.. IF YOU INSTALL THEM IT MAY CONFLICT WITH YOUR CURRENT VIRUS/FIREWALL SOFTWARE!!  To me all the complainers on here that said it caused their computers to freeze or not work is primarily due to the reason I just stated.  I have had no issues with this product, it works awesome.  It is way better than the product I had before this, and keeps my computer running at peak performance always.  It has a lot of bells and whistles so take the time to open all the tabs and set it up the way you want so you get the full benefit out of it and you will be as happy as I am with it.  Also, the price is very low for the quality and the best part is when you register the product with IOLO it will immediately update this to its most recent release (version 12) at no extra charge.. A version I might add that the company sells on their website for $60, almost 2x the price you pay here.. Highly recommended!!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2024

reviewDescription: This mask looks amazing, it's also got a lot of nice features but it isn't perfect.Viewing area is amazing, the buttons are all high-quality and easy to read, and once you strike an arc the visibility is incredible.The cons are it does not have an auto on function, it is dark enough off that it won't totally arc flash you, but still wish it had this feature. The adjustment on the sides that set the flip down of the mask constantly adjust in my welding bag when move it around and need to be reset when I go to reuse the mask. The strap to set how far your head sits in the mask pops off easily as well, I taped it to my head height to stop that. And finally the mask is a little on the heavy side, probably due to the choice of batteries, which is great since they're easy to replace, but I don't find I need to replace my mask batteries anyways.All in all the few issues do not outweigh the performance of this mask, would buy again.

reviewDescription: I originally gave this helmet a 5/5 but Ive had to change my mind after using it for a while. The site doesnt list this helmet under their product registration, so getting warranty is tough, to say the least.  The other issue is that there is a little gap between the helmet and the lens assembly.  When welding overhead, slag can get stuck in that gap and then you just end up smelling burning plastic for the rest of the day lol.  Not ideal but whatever.  The adjustment on the right side always gets loose, so I have to constantly tighten it.  Little things, but cant give it a 5.  Price was pretty good and it does work very well.  Very easy to use as well.

reviewDescription: The Sony Linkbuds S are a shrunk-down, improved version of the already excellent WF-1000XM4. I wasn't expecting this. Given the "Linkbuds" moniker I was expecting them to prioritize ambient sound features over all else, just like the original Linkbuds, but that simply isn't the case here.Build: the Linkbuds S are impossibly small compared to the WF-1000XM4, Sony's previous noise canceling earphones. They actually resemble the Samsung Galaxy buds 2 in overall size and shape. They also sport a nice large touch sensitive area that no one should have trouble missing. The only gripe I do have is that the outer surface is textured and this can cause some discomfort if it rubs against the crus helix.Case: the case is definitely one of the more pocketable out there. It's about the same size as the Airpods Pro case, but slightly shorter and narrower, albeit a bit thicker. However, it also has a textured surface which can make it a little difficult to slide in and out of pockets.Fit: the Linkbuds S fit very similar to the Galaxy Buds 2 and deeper than the WF-1000XM4. They are a little fiddly to fit. In my case I have to rotate them back and forth to get them to seat correctly. Although Sony instructs users to rotate the buds backwards to get a good fit I actually found this uncomfortable because the buds would rub against my Crus Helix and cause discomfort. Rotating them forward slightly fixed the issue. Once the buds were in place I found the fit to be secure and that, combined with their light weight, meant that it was easy to forget they were there. My one complaint about the fit is that the buds are so small that it's very difficult to insert them without either accidentally hitting the touch area or rubbing a finger against the noise canceling microphone, resulting in some static noise.Noise canceling: the noise canceling on the Linkbuds S is fantastic. Although the Linkbuds S are advertised as being open I actually found them to be more isolating than the WF-1000XM4s without noise canceling on. With noise canceling on I actually found the Linkbuds S to be slightly superior to the WF-1000XM4 in terms of blocking out background noise and they certainly blow the Galaxy Buds Pro/2 out of the water. I haven't had chance to test the Linkbuds S with very low frequency sounds (e.g. public transport, planes) but for blocking out office and household noise they're the best true wireless earphones I've tried.Sound: I saved the best to last. I was very pleasantly surprised with the sound quality of the Linkbuds S. The WF-1000XM4s were a big disappointment in this regard, with an overly dark presentation for my taste that led to recessed mids and lackluster treble. The Linkbuds S by comparison adopt a Harman-like tuning that presents mids and treble brilliantly with a satisfying bass boost that doesn't dominate the overall sound. The Linkbuds S definitely beat the WF-1000XM4s for overall sound and they're up there with the Galaxy Buds Pro/2, which are the reigning champs. Comparing the Galaxy Buds side by side with the Linkbuds S I honestly can't pick a favorite amongst the three, which I think is a very good thing.Other: in my limited tests the transparency features are great, as with the WF-1000XM4s. The only other thing that I think is worth noting is that the Linkbuds S struggle to maintain LDAC connectivity more than the WF-1000XM4s. This isn't surprising, given the small size, but is worth considering for anyone who wants to use LDAC in challenging environments or on the go.Wrap up: previously if I wanted to recommend a pair of true wireless earphones for someone I would have to include a 'but'. The Airpods Pro have great noise canceling but the sound isn't top tier and they don't play well with Android devices. The Galaxy Buds sound fantastic but the noise canceling isn't great and they don't play well with iOS. The WF-1000XM4s have top tier noise canceling and work well with both iOS and Android devices, but their sound isn't the best. The Linkbuds S on the other hand have top tier noise canceling, work excellent with both iOS and Android, and have excellent sound. These are now my default recommendation to anyone looking for new True Wireless earphones.Alternative picks: If it wasn't for the better Bluetooth connectivity of the WF-1000XM4s and the improved battery life the Linkbuds S would have made the XM4s redundant. Whether the increased price is worth it for those things will be up to the individual. I think there's still a case to be made for getting the cheaper Galaxy buds over the Linkbuds S if noise canceling isn't a priority. However, I think the only reason to pay more for the Airpods Pro would be if you really like the design and/or the enhanced integration with iOS is really important.
reviewTitle: The best true wireless earphones for everyone

reviewDescription: Outperformed my Sony WF-1000XM5, at least until I got better ear tips for the latter.  The LinkBud-S has a nice form factor and a comfortable fit.  Great noise cancelling too.  My only quibble is that wireless charging (of the case) would have been nice.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2025

reviewDescription: BUYERS BEWARE - DO NOT BUY IF YOU VALUE YOUR MONEY!!! The charging life of these earbuds nose dive after about a year and a half of use! Don’t get me wrong, the earbuds sound really good, but the fact that after purchasing two different pairs of these earbuds, BOTH PAIRS had the same battery life / charging issues. After about a year and a half of use, the right earbud holds just enough of a charge to function for a little over an hour and then dies rather abruptly, while the left earbud still has well over half of its charge left.I tried calling Sony tech support, and as I am sure you can guess, though the support person I spoke with was kind and patient, their troubleshooting did nothing to restore the battery life of my earbuds. I was then told to call a third party repair service, which just directed me to a website to submit a repair.The SoundConnect app used to manage the earbud settings and features is clunky to use at the best of times, not to mention updating the firmware for the earbuds is a painfully slow and clunky process as well.If you have an iPhone, be prepared to deal with connectivity issues when taking phone calls - and problems with the app on the iPhone working in sync with the earbuds themselves.Because of the sound and lightweight quality of the earbuds, I wanted to love them. However, given the $200 price tag for obviously poorly constructed electronics, I CANNOT RECOMMEND THESE EARBUDS TO ANYONE, unless you want to just waste $200 of your hard earned money.Take it from someone who has owned two pairs of these earbuds and can confirm, no matter how well you take care of the Sony Linkbuds earbuds, they will stop holding a charge rendering them pretty much useless after about about a year and a half of use, the SoundConnect app is less than good, updating the earbuds firmware is extremely slow and drawn out, connectivity issues when taking a call gets old fast…and now I’m finding my earbuds case looks like it isn’t holding a charge as well. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere!!!UPDATE:The "troubleshooting" the Sony customer service rep walked me through did nothing to help with my Linkbuds issues. As a matter of fact, now they are barely holding a charge...no joke. At least before the troubleshooting I got a little use out of them before the charge would die.The site the Sony customer service rep referred me to that I mentioned in my original review was not set up to take repairs for the Sony Linkbuds S earbuds at all. The information on the repair site basically suggested I find a local electronics repair shop. So, I tried that. Not one business I called worked on the Sony earbuds - and I live in a large, tech-centric city.  That was a total bust and waste of my time.Then, through a random online search, I found a link to Sony webpage that directed me to call United Radio Service Inc. for repairs, so I did.  The person I spoke with told me that the cost for parts and repair labor made it infeasible to repair the earbuds due to the fact that the cost of the repairs would be more than the purchase cost of the earbuds. Another bust.Finally, I also found out that the earbuds and the USB transceiver are all pre-set with information that allows them to communicate with and from each other. These settings can only be configured at a Service Center with all components present. For this reason, you can't just simply replace one missing part yourself, i.e. a damaged earbud, say with one that you find refurbished online.Bottom line: You can't actually get the earbuds repaired, and you can't replace a defective earbud. No matter what line of nonsense Sony tries to tell you. Once these stop working properly outside the timeframe of the warranty, you are out of luck.***Again, Don't waste your money or time with these earbuds.  Look elsewhere, you'll be glad in the long run that you did!***
reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY THE SONY LINKBUDS S EARBUDS!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2025

reviewDescription: Pros:Su Carga (la bateria promete lo que cumple)Buena App En iOS se comporta mejor y es mas estable, aunque en Android me funciono bien tambien pero aveces se desconectaban (use un iPhone 13 Pro Max y Un s22 Ultra)El sonido es bueno, tiene exceso de bajos, a mi me gusta mas planos, por que soy ingeniero de audio, pero con el ecualizador no tuve problema, ademas se sincroniza con mi cuenta, asi que si uso los auriculares en mi iphone o ipad recuerda la ecualizacion en la app.La Supresion De Ruido Es Magnifica (Mucho mejor que Airpods Pro) suprimen igual que los airpods pro pero no sacan ese ruido blanco molesto que aveces me sacaban los airpods pro, aunque no suprimen todo el ruido es decente.Para hacer ejercicio funcionaron bien, no se cayeron, quedaron fijos y no se movian.Cosas que no me gustaron:El material si bien es reciclado, tiene un tacto extraño, no es liso, parece mas un carton corrugado, se siente arenoso, y los audifonos tambien, es cuestion de gustos pero a mi me hubiera gustado que se sintiera listo y no arenoso y extraño.Los controles tactiles son buenos, pero solo te deja cambiar los predeterminados por la app para cada auricular, por ejemplo si elijes que con un auricular quieres cambiar el modo ambiente y el de supresion de ruido puedes hacerlo tocando un clic, pero si presionas dos clics no pasa nada, (la app no te permite pesonalizar), asi que al final tuve que optar por tener en el izquierdo la supresión y el modo ambiente, y del lado derecho el control de volumen, sacrificando cambiar de cancion o pausar (una lastima por que la podria poner del lado del control de ruido con dos clics)cuando se cierra la tapa se pierde la conexion, si quieres conocer el estado de bateria no basta con abrir la tapa, tienes que sacarlos para ver el estado en la app y se conecten los auriculares.No permite la conexion multidispositivo de forma rapida, es decir cuando tenia mis airpods podia pasar de mi iphone a mi mac, a mi ipad y los detectaba sin tocar nada, aqui no es asi tienes que irte al apartado de bluettooh y buscarlos (claramente primero tienes que emparejarlos, ya despues de eso se queda registrados pero tienes que buscarlos si cambias de dispositivo)El Modo Ambiente funciona bien, tiene una opcion para escuchar a las voces mas claras, pero no esta a la altura de otros del mercado, tu propia voz no se oye clara, se oye acartonada, tambien tiene mucho ruido blanco, aunque me gusto que se pueda controlar el nivel de ambiente o de sonido que quieres oir.vengo de unos airpods pro por que no me quedaban y me lastimaban la oreja, estos me quedan muy bien, se moldan perfecto a la estructura de la oreja, pero despues de una hora si me empezo a doler la oreja, si tienes la parte de la oreja donde va la forma circular del auricular muy pequeña puede que te moleste como ami, apesar de eso se sienten solidos y ergonomicos.Extras:los auriculares ofrecen extras en la aplicacion de sony, como el audio 360 que funciona bien pero solo funciona con ciertas aplicaciones, o el DSEE Extreme que optimiza los archivos digitales de música comprimida en tiempo real con Edge-AI (Se oia normal nada destacable), sin embargo ningun de estos extras le dan un plus a el auricular, haciendo que no destaquen mucho.los microfonos son pasables, no son geniales, pero te sacan del apuro no esperes lo mejor.Conclusion:Son buenos si tienes cualquier sistema operativo, recomiendo que se usen solo si los piensas escuchar en un solo dispositivo, ya que la interconectividad entre dispositivos es tediosa, por el precio creo que esta bien, la calidad del sonido me gusto y el modo de supresion de ruido es muy bueno, sin llegar a sentir tu oido taponado, cancelando un buen porcentaje de ruido.
reviewTitle: Equilibrados y Sonido Balanceado, Ergonomia Depende De Tu Oido
reviewedIn: Reviewed in Mexico on August 4, 2022

reviewDescription: I got this for 7.6k during the great Indian sale which is a steal!!! This comes very close to Sony's flagship tws, WF-1000XM4. The audio quality is mind blowing. The ANC is really good. You can say that it comes to about 90% of XM4's ANC capability. The battery life is decent but it doesn't matter to me much as I don't wear it continuously for more than 2 hrs and I put it back in the case after use. The comfort is great unlike the XM4 and you can wear it for a long time. It has a quick charge feature where a 5 min charge gives you 60 mins of playback. As mentioned by another reviewer, don't use the Equalizer in the Sony Headphones app. Install the Wavelet app and use its auto equalizer for Linkbuds S. The difference in quality is huge. Another useful feature is that you can connect to 2 devices at the same time.Do note that the right earbud is the primary unit and it consumes more power than the left one. There will be a slight difference in the battery to about 2 to 6% between both the earbuds. If you see a huge difference to about 12 to 20% or more, one of the earbuds is defective and you need to get it replaced.The only drawback I felt in this device is that during phone calls, the voice sounds mechanical and not natural. When I called my friend via the earbuds, he immediately asked me if I'm using some earphones or headphones as the clarity wasn't great. So if you are buying this device for calls, I will not recommend it. You can look at other premium devices like Samsung Buds 2 Pro, Airpods Pro 2, Bose QC 2, Oppo Enco X2 and the OnePlus Buds Pro 2. The latest Sony flagship, WF-1000XM5, is the best version of the XM4 and the Linkbuds S as it has incorporated all the positives from both devices. If you have the budget, then definitely go for the XM5.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in India on November 1, 2023

reviewDescription: Tl;Dr: Awesome for small ears and side sleepers. Good quality and easy to use. However, there's a whole app and a ton of features you might not use, making the price tag a little less worth it for you.I absolutely recommend these earbuds if you have small ears like me. I've never had earbuds that (even with the tiniest buds) don't hurt my ears or gradually slip and fall out due to how small my ears are. These are the first earbuds I've ever had that fit like a glove and are comfortable for hours on end. You can tell how well they fit in the pictures I attached. Swear to God, doctors should prescribe you these earbuds if they notice your ears are tiny lol.It's also awesome how low profile they are. Check out the attached picture for how little it sticks out from my ear. It's perfect if you like a lowkey style or if you like to lay on your side and listen to stuff. I can sleep on my side with both earbuds in for a good hour or two, which I really appreciate.I also appreciate their ease of use. Pairing them to a device is simple; just press a button on the back of the case. I also like all the touch controls, e.g. tap once on the left to switch from noise cancelling to ambient, tap 4x on the right to raise volume, etc. They work well while also not being oversensitive. Your music won't pause just because your hat or hair hit your ear, which is great.As far as quality goes, they're about what I'd expect for this price range. The sound quality is good and I like the different equalizer settings. I really like how it'll give you a little test and create an equalizer profile fit to your music taste. The noise cancelling is good enough and the ambient mode works well too. Lastly, the quality of the earbuds themselves is good. I didn't get the recycled plastic ones, but mine feel like good quality plastic.My sole complaint is that I feel like the value for money is off a bit if you don't care about the extra software. If you don't want to install the app that goes with the earbuds and set up the extra features, it feels like a bit of a waste.For example, there's this whole adaptive noise cancelling feature that will automatically adjust when (and how much?) noise is cancelled based on what you're doing and where you are. I haven't used this feature at all. Firstly, because it takes a set up process in a quiet place, which I never got around to doing. Secondly, it requires precise location data to be on and accessed at all times. Call me a boomer, but I don't think my earbuds need to or should know which cafés I frequent or what my schedule is like. It's a lot of work when it's already so easy to just manually switch them from noise cancelling to ambient when someone talks to you.It also supports 360° Dolby atmos sound, which is cooler in theory than in practice. Very few music streaming platforms support this sound. Tidal was the only one I recognized, and it seems like it's dropping the service soon. I can't help but wonder if the price could have been lower if it didn't have this feature that most customers won't use.Other people might feel the same about the equalizer settings or the ability to test and find the best fit for your ears. Anyway, if you don't care about these extra features, there might be a cheaper, simpler option for you.Either way, I don't think you'll be disappointed. I've had them for 6 months now and although the $200 price tag wasn't easy for me, I never regret my decision. I'll probably keep buying these until they stop making them lol.

reviewDescription: I recently got my hands on the JBL Reflect Aero True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds, and they have quickly become my go-to pair for everything from workouts to work calls. Here’s why they stand out:Sound Quality: The sound is exceptional, with deep bass and clear mids and highs. Whether I’m listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls, the audio is crisp and immersive. JBL never disappoints when it comes to delivering great sound.Noise Cancellation: The active noise cancellation (ANC) feature is a game-changer, especially in noisy environments. It effectively blocks out background noise, allowing me to focus on my music or calls without distractions. The ANC is adjustable, which is a nice touch for when you want to be aware of your surroundings.Call Quality: With 6 built-in mics and VoiceAware technology, call quality is top-notch. The person on the other end hears me clearly, even in windy or noisy conditions. I appreciate the clarity and consistency of the calls, which is essential for work.Fit and Comfort: The earbuds are designed with a secure fit in mind, and they stay in place even during intense workouts. They come with multiple ear tip sizes, so it’s easy to find the perfect fit. They’re also comfortable to wear for extended periods, which is a big plus.Battery Life: The battery life is impressive, with hours of playback time even with ANC turned on. The charging case provides additional charges, making it easy to keep them powered up on the go.Design: The sleek and modern design looks great, and the build quality feels premium. The touch controls are intuitive and responsive, making it easy to adjust settings or skip tracks without pulling out my phone.Conclusion: Overall, the JBL Reflect Aero True Wireless Earbuds are a fantastic choice for anyone looking for high-quality sound, effective noise cancellation, and reliable call performance. They’re perfect for both everyday use and more demanding activities. Highly recommend!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2024

reviewDescription: I bought a pair of these because of online recommendations for workout earbuds. But my first pair worked for about a day, and then something happened (i don't know what), but the case got messed up so it started producing a lot of feedback when in ambient aware mode, but the earbuds were in the case.  Then the earbuds would not turn on when i opened the case, unless the case was plugged in. I ended up getting a replacement pair, and so far so good. but I called customer support because i couldn't figure out how to remove the old profile from the JBL app. I couldn't find anything online about it. Customer service is clearly offshored. So the rep was hard to understand, and she couldn't understand me well either it seemed as if she had to constantly ask me to repeat the intake questions, which were pretty detailed, like what, when, where did you order from, what is the problem (asked 3 times), give me 3 forms of contact information, at which point, after about 10 minutes of intake, and still asking more demographic questions, all while being able to clearly hear what sounded like a party in the background, I asked her how much more information she'd need before we could get to the stated question, she hung up on me. I've worked customer support before and can understand how stressful the job can be. So I am usually pretty patient. but it was getting pretty bad as with each question she'd ask, she wasn't getting the answer correct, for example, she asked me 5 times what my surname was. is had to repeatedly tell her and spell out a 4-letter last name. Anyway, the customer service was so awful that I'm heavily considering returning the pair that works simply due to the poor customer service interaction, and writing off the brand completely.
reviewTitle: JBL customer service was horrible, overshadowed any positive qualities of the product
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2023

reviewDescription: I have had the product for less than three hours.  So far, I've had a 40 minute chat support that did not result in the earbuds passing the second step of setup, getting the right seal.While I managed to pair the earbuds with my iPad, I am thus far unable to pair them with my MacBook.The iPad app told me that the seal in the ear was not good, but provided no instruction on how to fix the problem. Should I use the larger or smaller provided rubber things?There are no markings on the earbuds that indicate left versus right ear that I am able to find.  But apparently it is important to know which is officially which because controls are on the side.  It took repeated questioning in the chat to finally be told the one that sits in the left side of the case is the left item.After ending the chat and struggling to get past the size setup, I failed to move beyond step three.  The app kept saying be in a noisy place with no instructions or feedback on how to find a noisy place.The FAQs within the app provides no guidance on how to actually control the volume.  Either the default volume is much to high, or I've managed to maximize it.The provided user manual is a picture book with fewer details than an Ikea piece of furniture.I have been unable to find official videos to resolve any of my questions.  I am entirely dependent upon finding videos from independent resources about various topics and often having to hope that similar JBL products function the same way.I will say using the iPad app installing a software update onto the earbuds was easy.  The app provided good information about the estimated time to install and then the time remaining.  This is why I gave two  stars rather than one.In short, unless you are a millennial, I would not recommend this product.I am unable to actually review the capabilities of the product.  Until I can figure out how to control the volume, it is worthless.  I have not attempted to use the product to conduct a phone call, listen to a podcast, exercise or swim, or any of the other basic functions I had hoped for.  I am also unable to provide star ratings for noise cancellation, sound quality, and battery life.

reviewDescription: These swivels rotate on two axes and allow your air hose to reach your air tool's air input port from any angle without binding. This means you won't have to fight the stiffness of the hose while trying to hold or position the air tool. Once you have these, you'll wonder how you got along without them. I've installed them on almost all of my air tools.Make sure when you order these swivels that you order the correct size for your tool. They come in 1/4", 3/8" and 1/2" NPT. These sizes refer to the inside diameter of the fitting. The most common size on hardware store air tools is 1/4". The larger sizes are found on tools requiring substantial airflow to operate properly like large grinders.Also make sure if you have a high-flow air tool that you aren't using the tiny quick-connect fittings that seem to be the default on most hardware store air tools. These fittings have only a 1/4" air passage and will restrict the airflow and performance of a high-flow tool. You should also be using a minimum of 3/8" ID hose (1/2" would be better) with the bigger tools if you want the performance you paid for. I use the 3/8" (P-Style) quick connectors on all my air tools and I use 1/2" hoses for most applications.Note that there are knock-offs of these connectors made by Dyna-Flo and some no-name manufacturers. While Dyna is a quality manufacturer of air tools, their swivel connectors are made of plastic and won't last as long as the Milton brand which are machined from billet aluminum. The others fail and start leaking at the seals in even light-duty use. I'm replacing them all with Milton brand when they fail. Buy the Milton's and you'll be happier in the long run.
reviewTitle: You'll want these on all your air tools!
