reviewDescription: I purchased this for my husband for him to track his workouts and also his general health stats. I was hesitant because the reviews are not great and some of the cheaper trackers that look like this seemed to have better reviews, but no real company behind them. Ultimately, I decided on this brand because it appears to be the only real company and not someone drop shipping.  It's been a week, and my husband is using it and enjoying it with no complaints.  It was very easy to set up and accessing your data through the app is simple enough. I did not love that after the first year the membership is over $230, but we'll deal with that when the time comes.
reviewTitle: If you love body data, this is for you.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2025

reviewDescription: It would be a five star rating had the company not mislead existing customers and were honest about "upgrade" costs. Price of the product with a 12 month extension now waves the $50 cost of the upgrade from the 4.0.  I had an existing 6-7 months on my membership.I'm hoping member out-lash will help the company focus more on customer satisfaction (customer service) over hard/rigid pricing. Another problem with the pricing side of the device is the hard push on the subscription model and locking customers in with no flexibility. This doesn't build customer/consumer loyalty/confidence. The device itself, and software are great products. Unfortunately, I will have to order more straps since the 4.0 ones will not fit the 5.0I expressed my disappointment to Whoop and CS offset the $50 up-charge in "good faith" by giving me a credit towards accessories/clothing in my Whoop account. I appreciated that as it was unexpected. It took them about 24hrs to respond to me through Faceb00k. Loyal customers want a considerate/loyal/thoughtful company that allows them to feel supported when issues/concerns arise... It causes hesitation for people to enter into the ecosystem/community. Word of mouth goes a long way for when it comes to having a positive experience with a company that requires an extensive and expensive financial commitment. I appreciate the timely communication and them offering something back due to the concerns I expressed. I also own an Oura ring and their CS has been amazing valuing existing and foreseeable members.I am an existing Whoop 4.0 member. I've had the product for around a year in a half. Purchasing my Whoop through Amazon was pretty seamless. I opted for Amazon due to unknown shipping times through Whoop's website, spotty customer service at times, and a building resentment that I may not stay a member because of how they treat customers. Also, the return policy with Amazon had I had any further issues with the Company.When I paired the 5.0 to the whoop app on my phone the membership time was automatically increased 12 months and the new module paired seamlessly. I got a notification through the app after pairing the 5.0 that my 12 months was added to my remaining membership time of 6 months. I was concerned that being an existing member I may not be able to purchase the device through Amazon... For those already members, I assume you shouldn't have any issues either.In summary, I did not pay any extra for the updated device. I did pay for an additional 12 months, which I had not planned for initially due to Whoop going back on their word. Seems like they are responding positively to upset customers such as myself. I received the Whoop 5.0 next day shipping without issue from Amazon.5/25/25Changed my rating from 4/5 stars to 3/5. Again, product works well overall, but the business practices are extremely questionable. They recently updated their “terms of use” and “privacy policy” to cover up their dishonesty and abusive management/sales tactics. It’s so sad to have a great product marred by terrible management/marketing. I’m considering leaving the company, returning the product, sending back everything (straps and charger) I got for the product. Again, it’s something I enjoy using overall, by I am hard pressed to recommend it to other people I care about because of how they abuse their customers/members. I am almost embarrassed to wear the product at this point because of the company’s growing poor reputation.
reviewTitle: Solid hardware/software, but Whoops needs to focus on taking care of current members as a priority.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2025

reviewDescription: I have purchased this product several times from Amazon.  This time, for reasons that neither Amazon nor Microsoft can explain, the code only partially worked.  It is a 1 year (365 day) subscription.  When I applied the code I got 187 days, not 365 days.I called Microsoft and spent a long time working with them, and they could not see why it did not apply the full 365 days.  They were able to confirm I did purchase a 365 day code.  They said I had to contact Amazon as they were the 3rd party that sold it and ask them to resolve or refund.Amazon said they sold the code, and the sale was their only responsibility.  The fact that it didn't provide 365 days was immaterial.  They very politely told me they would do nothing and it was my tough luck.  They had zero interest in helping me.I went back to Microsoft, who to their credit was interested in making it right, and provided a way to extend it to the full year as they had seen evidence that I had purchased it.  I am very happy with the M365 product, Microsoft's support, but the 1 star rating is for Amazon refusal to support a defective product they sold and the fact that they did not care they were ripping me off.
reviewTitle: Product is good but Amazon's support is not!

reviewDescription: This is a criticism of my purchase experience regarding this software , not a criticism of the software itself. I received an empty  box with a pc key number card. This was first time I bought software without a cd disk. I prefer the old fashion way. Pop a cd in and install the software to your computer. The card with the activation key numbers only provided  a Pinnacle website link, but no instructions on the downloading process to follow.  When I went to  Pinnacle website there was only the option to buy the software but no option  to download it after purchasing it from Amazon. I then contacted Amazon customer service three times via chat to get instructions on how to download the software. They were unable to provide step by step instructions . I was given an Amazon links but it did not resolve the issue.I then went online to find out what the process was .  I found instructions on the Amazon website which stated to go to my orders , find the software purchased and  there should be a download option next to the order . Tried this but could not find any download option next to the order . I even looked in the digital downloads section and software library but still could not find this purchase.  I literally spent almost two hours trying to download the software but no avail.I will again state that I prefer the original way to install software , receiving  a cd installation  disk.  It is easier, less time consuming and less frustrating.The Bottom line is I had to return the box  it to Amazon and I will buy the software directly on the Pinnacle website.

reviewDescription: One of the most useful features I take advantage of regularly is using a PDF program to let me form-fill PDF documents instead of doing it by hand. Adobe Reader, the free reader from Adobe, has this functionality. However, this software won't identify form fields and automatically activate them to let you fill in a form.  Yes, you can put in your own form fields but that's tedious. So this was a disappointment.I also found the OCR feature a little wonky. I took a screenshot of a page of text and them imported that using the OCR  functionality. It didn't import the whole image (the right side was cut off) but it did identify the text in the rest of the image.  There is an option to scan in a document instead of importing, but that uses TWAIN and I can't run TWAIN on my computer.For the price this may have a decent feature package for most people. Just for me I can't depend on it to do what I often need to do.OCR worked but only converted part of the imageCan't identify form fields and activate them automatically so that you can easily form-fill a PDF document.Depends on TWAIN for scanning
reviewTitle: Okay for the price but some key features lacking

reviewDescription: I recently used a combination VHS/DVD burner to copy my home made VHS tapes to DVD-R dvds.  I then used this VideoConverter Ultimate software on my windows 10 pc convert the DVDs to .mp4 files so I could store all my videos in a folder on my PC for easy access.  I play these .mp4 files using CyberLink PowerDVD 18 software.  Now that the video files are stored as .mp4 files, I can also easily import them into my Corel VideoStudio 2018 software to edit the videos to add titles and soundtracks etc. I have only used the VideoConverter Ultimate software to create a .mp4 file with properties of 720x480 29.97 fps so I can't vouch for all of the output formats that it supports.  In my limited use of the program so far, I have not experienced any bloatware etc. The program only takes about 2 minutes to install. The case that the software CD comes in has a registration code inside the case that you have to type in during the installation process. I wish all software installations were this easy!  I gave 5 stars to all categories.  The best Tech Support is one that you never have to deal with!
reviewTitle: Converted My Burned DVDs to .mp4 Files

reviewDescription: This program is well reputed by reviewers, so I paid the high price.  Those reviewers, irresponsibly, did not mention the following:  The installer tries to install extra add-ons, which you can turn off, BUT they then pop up insistently, over and over, until first re-boot.  When you run the program after registering, it tries to alter your Windows settings to give it access to the Internet from your computer.  When registering, it confusingly requires, not YOUR email, but the email of the Wondershare company.  In summary: I paid the high price for this program to avoid the add-ons that often come with free programs. ...and got abusive install attempts anyway.  Operation seems good, but not exceptional; the graphic format, controls, and logical interface are ordinary, not as good as AnyVideo Converter.  ...so, this abusive program is NO better than the freebies.  Don't waste your money, and suffer the dangers of having un-wanted add-ons installed without your approval....meaning they have no way to advise of problems.

reviewDescription: Vor 25 Jahren begann ich mit  Video8-Aufnahmen. Leider war die Videokamera nach 10 Jahren defekt. Die Filme konnte ich davor noch nicht von Kassette auf PC überspielen. Aus dem Grund war es in den letzten 15 Jahren nicht möglich, die Filme anzuschauen. Mittlerweile gibt es die Möglichkeit, Videokassetten digitalisieren zu lassen. Auf diese Art erhielt ich nach langer Zeit die alten Filme als Datei zurück. Alle digitalisierten Filme hatten die volle Kassettenlänge, auch wenn die Kassetten damals zum Teil nicht vollständig bespielt waren. Somit waren die Dateien teilweise viel zu groß.Als Nutzer von Windows 10 suchte ich ein einfaches, preiswertes Programm zur Filmbearbeitung, was nicht ganz einfach war. Am Ende habe ich mich für VideoConverter Ultimate entschieden. Hiermit lassen sich zahlreiche Film-Datei-Formate bearbeiten.Die Verwendung ist recht einfach. Ich bin kein großer Filmspezialist, aber selbst für mich war es problemlos möglich, meine Dateien anzupassen. Am Ende der Filme vorhandene, unbespielte Abschnitte der Originalkassetten habe ich entfernt. So kürzt sich die Filmlänge auf Originaldauer und die Dateigröße reduziert sich entsprechend. Einige der letzten Filmaufnahmen zeigten bereits Fehler durch die damals beginnenden Mängel der Videokamera. Mittels Einstellungen des Programms lassen sich Farben und Kontrast anpassen sowie Rauschen am Filmrand korrigieren. Dadurch sehen die Filme deutlich besser aus. Das Datei-Format lässt sich u.a. von AVI in mp4 ändern. Die Dateigröße eines 90 Min.-Films ließ sich so von 4 GB auf unter 2 GB reduzieren. Trotzdem sah die Qualität auf dem PC-Monitor und dem 40"-TV unverändert gut aus. Aus Filmdateien lassen sich mit dem Programm kleine Szenen ausschneiden, d.h. ein großer Film wird zu einem ganz kurzen Abschnitt reduziert und dieser gespeichert. Damit konnte ich an die Familie per WhatsApp kleine Grüße aus der alten Zeit schicken.VideoConverter ist ein einfaches Programm, dass mir als Hobby-Filmer bei der Filmbearbeitung problemlos unter die Arme greift.
reviewTitle: Greift dem Hobby-Filmer bei der Filmbearbeitung problemlos unter die Arme

reviewDescription: Die Wonder der Reihe nach:  1. Nach der Installation erfahre ich, dass ich lediglich die Möglichkeit erworben habe, die Vollversion zu kaufen. Aber immerhin habe ich erfolgreich den "Wondershare-Pass registriert". Und damit darf ich auf eine Herstellerseite, wo mir eben dies kundgetan wird.2. Aber ich darf das Programm ausprobieren, also unter vorkonfigurierten Möglichkeiten eine Videodatei konvertieren lassen. Das Video wird dann zu einem Drittel konvertiert. Die genauen Parameter der Konvertierung kann ich leider nicht nachvollziehen, finde Null Info dazu, und die Qualität ist leider mäßig. 3. Die Software sagt beim Start, dass es ein Update gibt, wenn man darauf klickt, werden Dateien heruntergeladen und installiert, am Schluss heißt es dann man, man solle das Programm beenden, damit die Updates installiert werden können, macht man das, ist ALLES beendet. Und beim nächsten Start wird man wieder darauf hingewiesen: "Es gibt ein Update..." Liebe Leute, ich will ja gar nicht ausschließen, dass bei der Installation irgendetwas etwa schief gelaufen ist, ABER: DVD einlegen, Programm installieren, Schlüssel eingeben und dann läuft es, also so kenne ich das. Wenn das für Euch zu hoch ist, seid ihr Versager.  Viele Grüße vom WonderWolf.

reviewDescription: Ich hab noch nie einen Stern vergeben, aber hier möchte ich es gar nicht anders. Ich wollte ein Programm für einfach Aufnahmen haben. Doch es lässt sich das Format nicht ändern (Programm sagt, funktioniert nicht) und wenn man dann in dem doofen Format aufnimmt, was man eigentlich nicht haben möchte, und man schaut sich das Video dann an, ist die Geschwindigkeit einfach mal eine ganz andere. Der Ton läuft normal, aber auch mit Störungen (separate Audioaufnahme war in Ordnung) und das spielt läuft so schnell, als wäre alles vorgespult. Zu keinem Zeitpunkt trifft das Bild auf den Ton, so wie ich es aufgenommen hatte.Da hatte ich mit dem kostenlosen MovieMaker Programm überhaupt keine Probleme mit.Ich mache keine super professionellen Videos, aber ich finde das Programm sehr schwer im Umgang. Wer einfache Videoaufnahmen damit machen möchte, dem rate ich definitiv ab. Hier sind auch zusätzlich Bugs drin, denn bei der normalen Aufnahme, speichert das Programm gar nicht erst ab. Man muss schon erstmal den Knopf finden, dass sich ein einzelnes Fenster dann öffnet und aufnimmt und dann auch wirklich abgespeichert wird.Keine Empfehlung.Die Installation und Registrierung war einfach und verständlich. Bringt am Ende aber nichts, wenn das Programm ein Fail ist. Auch Kurzvideos von Pixabay, die ich zu meiner Meditation zufügen wollte, nahm er nicht. Der QuickTime Player sei nicht installiert...was nicht stimme.
reviewTitle: Leider Katastrophal und viel zu kompliziert für einfache Aufnahmen

reviewDescription: Right after my purchase, I could not use the given keycode to register the Lastpass Password Manager. It gave an unresolved error message, repeatedly. Then I requested Webroot Support to remove the 30-day Trial Version on the LastPass Password Manager anyhow, because I wanted my new subscriptions all to renew at the same time next year. Also, trial versions often do not include all the paid version features; I believed a 1-Year subscription to Lastpass Premium was included in my purchase of Webroot Premium and I did not want to wait to get what I had purchased. The Webroot Support could not remove the Trial Version status, so they sent me to the Lastpass Support, which was the WORST support I ever had.The LastPass Support delayed answering for days, and until my second request, as I waited to set up my passwords. Then after a few  useless, back and forth communications, from their Support Portal on their website, they instructed me to answer all questions and send proof of purchase in an email they sent me. Questions: "How many password records should we expect to see in your account?" (Answer: 0) and "What year and month would be the date of the oldest entry in your account?" Ugh. Then, NO REPLY to that! The website portal kept saying, "Waiting for customer's reply." Their Support Portal and Email communications are not connected. I went to their website portal and told them I sent the email, but still no answer.I fully understand the reasonable, nonreturnable policies on software subscriptions, but in my opinion, this was a defective product and it was falsely advertised. The Amazon Service Rep said they would make this a special case and refund the Webroot Premium I purchased.Then afterward, I received an email from Lastpass, saying my trial period had ended, with a link to their shopping cart to purchase the Premium version. I had suspected that the reason the Lastpass Support kept stalling was that after 30 day, surprise! I was going to have to pay for the 1-Year subscription, that I believed came with the Webroot Premium subscription. I cannot say that for sure, but it sure looks like it.Don't waste your money on this product. They should explain, correct, or remove their advertisement about the LastPass Password Manager (Trial or Premium?) that has no support.
reviewTitle: Terrible! LastPass Password Manager is only a Trial Version!

reviewDescription: Garden Planner is an easy way to do simple (and not so simple) layouts of your property.  While is takes a few extra steps to do certain things (repetitive), as I use it, it gets quicker.  I really like the ability to have dimension lines for locating things and relationships.  For instance, a curved flower bed with trees located accurately.  Also there are layers you can turn on and of, like show trees, or don't show trees, very handy.I am in the process of mapping out my plantings to help layout drip irrigation zones.I am still learning of many features while exploring the program.  I should mention that there is a free upgrade to the current version available on the Garden Planner website.All things considered, this is a solid, capable program that rivals the expensive CAD software I have looked at... and id almost free in comparison

reviewDescription: Jason Statham stars as Levon Cade in the title role. He is a former special ops military, attempting to keep a low profile as a construction supervisor.  His wife is dead. Because of his violent past, the custody of his daughter (Isla Gie) is with her grandfather, who dislikes Levon.  When the boss's ( Michael Peña) daughter (Arianna Rivas) gets taken by the Russian mafia, Cade is asked to help as the police won't help.Set mostly in rural Illinois (filmed in England right after Beekeeper) this is a typical one-man vigilante film. There is nothing in the feature that should surprise you. Cliche.  Straightforward like a blessed Steven Seagal film. Characters were distinct enough to keep you engaged. reviewDescription: In this new movie based on the novel Levon's Trade by Chuck Dixon (who is also a co-writer on this), Levon Cade (played by Jason Statham) is a former soldier and a construction foreman. His boss' daughter Jenny Garcia (Ariana Rivas), is kidnapped, and he uses his skills to try to track her.This reunites Jason Statham and director David Ayer from the Beekeeper. One's surprised they just didn't do a sequel given its success and considering how similar Statham's character and the basic plot of a man avenging a wrong against a good person is, but apparently Sylvester Stallone (who also co-wrote) brought the script to Statham, and he brought the script to Ayer. Though I'd say Beekeeper was the superior film as it was more willing to go over-the-top, this film is a pretty solid follow-up.The action gets violent and crazy; the final fight is delightfully insane and memorable. Like Beekeeper, you've got a ton of distinctive baddies (played by a pretty solid bunch of actors, including League of Extraordinary Gentlemen/Pennyworth's Jason Flemying, who I'm surprised isn't better known. He's good in whatever he's done.)There are also some unique outfits and hideout designs in here. It can be a little weird seeing Cade walk amongst regular people and architecture only to walk into someone wearing brightly colored outfit in an eccentric looking-chari, but I wouldn't call that a deal breaker.The setup is a little wooden (though not slow, the movie speeds right through). The exposition about Cade's life doesn't feel natural. Plus, he's got a custody battle subplot that is supposed to help endear the character, but it feels forced and the daughter (The Outlaw's Isla Gie) and the former father-in-law (sorry, couldn't figure which actor was him) he's having the custody fight with don't sound like real people. However, once the movie gets to the action, that's when everything comes into place and things get going.Statham is again great as the tough guy who is determined and mows down everyone in his way, though he can't sell some of the poorly written dialogue moments. Michael Pena is good in his limited screen time as the emotionally distressed father of Jenny.Recommended. If you loved the Beekeeper, like I said, it won't be exactly it, but it'll probably wet your whistle. (Just walk into this knowing that A Working Man takes itself slightly more serious than the Beekeeper.)

reviewDescription: I couldn't believe my eyes when I stumbled upon Jumpstart 1st Grade Classic! This was the game that sparked my love for learning as a child. I remember spending countless hours exploring the magical world and having so much fun while mastering essential first-grade skills.Now, it's my daughter's turn to experience the joy of learning with Jumpstart! She's absolutely hooked on the colorful characters and engaging activities. It's incredible to see her developing her reading, math, and problem-solving skills while having a blast. It's like passing on a cherished family tradition!Jumpstart 1st Grade Classic is a timeless classic that continues to deliver on its promise of making learning fun and effective. I wholeheartedly recommend it to any parent looking for an educational and entertaining tool for their child.

reviewDescription: As a previous reviewer wrote, this version of Jumpstart will not work on newer Mac's.  I have OS X 10.6.  The evaluation part works but once you start to play the game somehow the sound goes down to barely audible.  My granddaughter could not hear any of the instructions.  She got frustrated really fast.  Too bad, Knowledge Adventure didn't tell us that the program would not work on newer MACs before we bought it.  Knowledge Adventure SHOULD have a free upgrade posted on their web site to download to fix these bugs.  I am $$$$orry that I did not take the time to read the reviews.-
